text: Yes, they are slow, but the food is cooked to order in a small kitchen!  It's worth the wait......so think about chillin while you wait. If they tried to rush you out to boost their volume, you would be mad about that!

I LOVE Cajun Yard Dog. Every time I come here, the food is amazing and the service is excellent. Such a cute place to go with friends or family. I love their jalapeno deviled eggs and their bread pudding. OMG best bread pudding ever. I usually get the tabasco strips with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. I never regret it. Some of the tastiest food in Charlotte, in my opinion.

NOM .COM!!! This place is really really good. I've been coming here for about 10 years, and haven't been disappointed yet. The fried chicken is probably the best chicken I've ever had in my entire life. The place is really small, and there's always a short wait to get in, but it's definitely worth it. Definitely the best Cajun place in the area, and probably one of the best places in general in my opinion.

Great food and atmosphere 
Jalapeño deviled eggs were an amazing appetizer. We had the shrimp and grits, andoille pasta, and the crab cakes. All were extremely flavorful. We ended with the bananas foster dessert witch was amazing and was devoured  in a manner of a shark feeding frenzy

This place is well over priced for the service, food and atmosphere. Strike one is that in our visit for our first time was with a large party, and we were initally informed it would possibly be anywhere from an hour or 2 to be seated. The hostess was not willing to truly work at first with us, and made us feel that we were inconviencing her. We nearly left, but we were given the option to be seated in another fashion and we gave it a try. Honestly, the service was poor. Our server didn't smile an inkling, and it felt as though we were somehow an imposition on her. Our food was delivered in a timely manner, but to be frank...the food was average. It tasted good, but it was very laden with oil and the balsamic vinaigrette for the salad is extremely sweet. And something I ate there left me ill by the end of the evening. To top it all off, the decor is extrmely tacky and you could see dust around the restaurant. My husband and I, personally, will not recommend this place to our friends...nor will we be returning.

It's not 100% authentic Cajun but it fulfilled the craving of a La/TX transplant. The fried chicken was incredible and fried to order. Shrimp and grits were very tasty. The only disappointment was the gumbo - good flavor, poor consistency. I will visit again soon.

The Cajun Yard Dog is always good for catfish, blackened salmon & étouffée. Great sides including fried okra, smothered cabbage, grits, Mac & cheese + greens. The restaurant is small so expect a wait until later in the evening. Consistently good!

I eat here at least once every two weeks for one dish and one dish only, a bowl of seafood gumbo! I'm from the south and have tasted some good homemade gumbo, but this is some of the best I've had in a restaurant. Huge shrimp top it all off and the seafood in it is a meal all by itself! 

It's not on the menu though so ask for it by name but I guarantee you'll be as pleasantly surprised as I was. I gave it 4 stars because a friend of mine recently came with and tried the Ceasar salad, chicken gumbo side, and red beans n rice side. He said the salad was amazing but bigger than he thought and the sides just tasted ok. 

I can ONLY vouch for the seafood gumbo.
Love it! The service is always great the food is even better! There is a wait sometimes, but it's definitely worth it! The people are nice a really homie place!

Everything is made from scratch from the appetizers to the desserts and everything is to die for. The fried oysters were fantastic even for those who don't usually like oysters. Everything fried was delicious, the crust is just perfect. The grilled fish was also very flavorful and fresh. 

Beyond the food, our server was incredibly nice and helpful. You can tell that everyone who works there loves it too and wants you to enjoy your meal as much as possible. The line is always out the door at peak times and for obvious reasons. If you are trying to avoid the line, coming early is always a good idea.

Geesch, where can you stop by for the BEST shrimp/grits, collards, and ice cold beer??? The Cajun Yard Dog. This place will not disappoint. Ask for Alexandria too. She was very informative/helpful. Enjoy!!

Horrible! We waited a really long time to be seated, then waited a really long time to be served. I ordered the special skirt steak which was so overdone it was like rubber. It had no taste or seasonings at all! My husbands chicken cordon bleu was horrible as well. The roumalaude sauce was ketchup mixed with horseradish...have these people even been to New Orleans! Very expensive for quality and quantity! Will not be returning!

Family vacation to visit friends who now live in NC. We are all originally from NOLA and wanted to give this place a try. We were in the mood for home cooking. I have to say they were not bad. The fried chicken was good and they do something really special with their cabbage that I have never seen but made it really good. My girls 7 and 9yrs had the mac n cheese and loved it. The red beans were luck warm when they came to our table and tasted can. The seafood was OK but could use a little more seasoning (you know how we like our seasoning). The service was also good the waitress was very nice.

This was my first time here! I had the FGBLT (blt with fried green tomatoes).  It was delicious! The atmosphere is cozy and fun.  The service was excellent.   The right combo of efficiency and friendly!!  I'm only sad it's not closer to my house.

Excellent food and service.  Ask for Jenna to be your server, she's awesome.  I have had the blackened Mahi and Wahoo, both excellent.  My wife gets the jambalaya, which has just enough spice and the seafood in it is delicious.  However, the highlight is the fried okra?!!!  

You must go here and discover this gem in the arboretum...

Love this restaurant!  We've been coming here for years and have always had a wonderful experience.  I've read some of the other negative reviews and I couldn't disagree more!!!  We are regulars too, but we do not expect special treatment.  Isn't a wait a good sign of a great restaurant with excellent food and terrific service??  

I cannot speak more highly of the food.  I absolutely LOVE their cajun dishes and always end the meal with a dessert (the chocolate/pecan pie is my favorite!).  

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great meal in an awesome atmosphere.
Fantastic food.  Would definitely come back here next time I am in Matthews.  My grandmother loved it.

We eat here about once a month.  The food is good quality and spiced just right.
The staff is very welcoming and friendly, the owner is always there and very friendly.   Great specials, seafood, meatloaf, mac & cheese, cheese grits,  and veggies, the desserts are the best!!!   Never had a bad meal here.

This place's menu held much promise for me, but was quite a disappointment.  I've only been there once, but there was a common characteristic running through all their food that was hard to ignore...no seasoning!

I love Cajun food, primarily because I enjoy the type of food and the spices.  At CYD, you can find all your favorites on the menu; just don't look for them to be properly seasoned.

Jalepeno Deviled Eggs:  there was an essence of jalapeno but absolutely no kick...and no salt.  Just a bland deviled egg.

Fried Oysters:  A little too greasy and absolutely no seasoning in the batter.  I'll go so far to say that they were the most bland fried oysters I've ever been served.

My sides were "all day green beans" (bland), collards (bland), and slaw (bland).

The quality of food was pretty good.  Just don't look for authentic cajun flavor here.  Maybe I hit them on a bad day, but you'd think that I would've liked something here...but not so much.  Seriously...salt, cayenne, and peppers are pretty cheap.  CYD ought to invest five bucks and give these a try.

I consider myself a connoisseur of fried food.  And while that may not strike some people as anything to brag about, Cajun Yard Dog acts as proof that there is a right and a wrong way to fry.  And by God, they do it right.

I could go on for pages about this place, as it's certainly my personal favorite in Charlotte.  But I'll simply mention the sides, service and the beer.

Most entrees are accompanied by 2 sides.  Those sides range from collared greens to sweet potato fries, from gumbo (extra $) to some of the best mac and cheese I've ever eaten.  

The service isn't always fast.  But even someone as picky as I am about service will be pleased by the friendly, knowledgeable waiters. 

The beer selection is pretty phenomenal for a place of this breed.  Lagers, Ambers, Fruit beers (including Purple Haze from Louisiana's Abita) Porters, Stouts,etc.  Basically, even micro brew drinkers can consistently find a beer that they've never tried.  

If you enjoy spicy food, fried food, good food or good beer, do yourself a favor and try Cajun Yard Dog: Charlotte's creole connection.

My dull witted friend suggested we try this place. I agreed only because my planet smashingly hot girlfriend agreed with him for some reason. Usually we know better than to go along with his harebrained schemes.
Ordered apps, catfish bites, fried green tomatoes. Both pretty unremarkable. I don't know when the last time the kitchen changed their frying oil, but  by the taste of it probably about 14 years ago. Green tomatoes were weak at best.
Ordered the jambalaya and it was a mushy practically tasteless mess.
Dumb friend didn't much enjoy his meal, but he's dumb so I don't lend much weight to his dumb opinions...cause he's dumb.
The eye scorching dame I call my girl ordered the fried chicken, tasted like it was fried in ash, And the topper was cold french fries!! Really? Cold french fries, Total bushleague shit CYD.
Won't be back.

We have been going to the Dog since we found it tucked away in Arboretum a few years ago.  Everything is consistently fresh and extremely tasty.  We go for lunch at least once a month on Saturdays and my wife always gets whatever the fresh catch of the day is and it is always wonderful and she can be picky!

We have tried almost everything and it is always great.  Last year, I had all my buddies from the office there to rave reviews.  If you like a bit of spice, ask for the dog sauces...the one with the ghost pepper is fantastic; flavor with good kick.

One thing though...bring back the pulled pork sandwich!!!  That was the bomb!

We love this place! By our second visit we had met the owner so by our third visit he knew our names. Wait staff and owner did all the could to make sure we enjoyed our meal. Food has been great each time: blackened salmon, shrimp/andouille pasta and the Seafood Jambalaya all were amazing! Def one of our favorites!
Great little restaurant.  One of the best places in Charlotte.  Been numerous times and never had a bad anything.  Staff is great.  One of the only places I take visitors to Charlotte to eat.

Brought home a 16pc box this evening based on friends' assurances it was some of best in Charlotte. I found the chicken to be devoid of spice and way over cooked.  Maybe they were having an off night, but there is no way that I would order fried chicken here again . However, the collard greens and Mac n cheese were quite good.

Great restaurant for years. We have been hundreds of times. Lately we limited our ordering to fried chicken which remains great.  Other choices have been declining in quality to the point of being sometimes inedible.  We have sent fish back three times in a row.  Veggies watery and overcooked except the greens which have gone from sublime to tasting like cardboard.  You have to beg for the included biscuits and pay a dollar for honey.  Waits for tables are always long and even regulars are ignored when there are open tables at busy times.  Last night we planned as usual to arrive before the rush at 5:45 so we could dine in time to reach a movie.  Two tables for 4 were open when our friends arrived and they asked to be seated.  The hostess was rude and nasty saying they would have to wait until we all were there.  We were late by 5 minutes because of a call about our mother from the rest home she just moved to.  They complained and asked the manger to seat them explaining their predicament.  They got the last table for 4 and the gruff hostess knowing we were soon arriving promptly ripped the additional two chairs from the table even though there was no one waiting at that minute for these two chairs without a table.  Knowing this would not work,our friends left.  On the way out,the father of the hostess who has to our knowledge no association with the restaurant flipped off our friend and his wife and told him to, "get a life di..head".  At which point our friend appropriately dropped the f bomb toward this sicko.  When I arrived and was told of what happened by our friends wife, I asked to meet with the owner,Ron Atherton, who told us the hostess was simply following policy. He called our friends liars even though i didn't tell him what they said. I told him it was a stupid policy and that it was now our policy not to dine there again despite being regulars for years,essentially since the day it opened.  Will miss the chicken but not the rest of the crap.  There is always New South in the same center, always great with the nicest owners in the world and the fantastic Table274 in Cotswald to replace this tired old dive with a rude owner.

This spot is FOR REAL. I've been up and down this menu and have yet to find something I don't like. The service has always been good, and Al (the owner) is always present and asking how everything is. Great local spot, and true New Orleans flavor!!
Sorry, this place doesn't get it. I went two years ago and it was ok but this week it was C- at best. The catfish was greasy and the oysters were soggy. Must have changed hands recently.

Been here a few times in the past since the "new" ownership took over a few years ago.  Hadn't been there for a while... decided to return with the family for dinner.  I was SHOCKED to see how much the prices had risen.  I've worked in several professional kitchens.  I understand food costs, profit margins, etc.  Trust me, WAY overpriced.  Needless to say, I was disappointed.  I gathered the family and left as soon as I saw the menu...something I've never done.  Like I said, the food's alright.  I respect the individual restaurateur, usually some of the hardest working people you'll meet.  But, I work hard for my money too.  CYD, you're gonna have to do better than that.

Cajun - Smajun - this place rocks!  Cabbage is to die for!  Quirky wines and unknown beers are there for the adventurous.  Lynn is a hoot - ask her for beets next time you are in (inside joke).  Their pimento cheese could bring world peace!  A must try but an even bigger repeat performance restaurant - eat here regularly and have never had anything but the best!
Great food (blackened red fish was AMAZING), and excellent service. Fun for the whole family. Definitely going back!!!

First time here. Surprised by the quality of our lunch. Staff very friendly. Chicken waffles great. Mix of Cajun and southern foods. We all enjoyed the food and experience. I'll be back for the shrimp and grits next time.

I love this spot. Great food and service. Specials everyday [maybe weekdays only?]
Plenty of room. Recommend

Celebrated New Years with some close friends and wanted to brag about what a great experience we had. Our Server Lynn, was very friendly and knowledgeable. She made great recommendations. We all had different plates from fried chicken, Blacken Mahi Mahi and the Spicy Cajun Jambalaya. Great Food, Great Service and nicely priced.
The service was really good as our server was attentive and prompt. My date was pleasantly surprised by how delicious his fried was.

I had a seafood craving and did my Yelp research on this place.  It was seat yourself and it took a bit to get anyone to the table even though the dining area was almost empty, so of course I'm sititing there freaking out wondering if this was a good idea while checking out the distressed walls, some TVs, and a non-overpowering Mardi Gras theme.  Not sure what was my apprehension because I was overwhelmingly pleased with Everything!
I had to try one of everything, but settled on the shrimp platter, meatloaf po boy, etouffee, and seafood jambalaya.  Like I said, everything was good, but let's focus on the that meatloaf.
My sons have never had a real po boy, which in my experience has always been a battered fried seafood.  I asked our server her recommendation and she "promised" the meatloaf version would be worth it.  Oh, if I could eat one of these every day!!! 
I'm also a beer girl and had a little bit of trouble navigating the list, as it was just the labels and not the style of beer, but again my knowedgable server was able to assist.  I had a refreshing german pilsner while waiting for the food to arrive but switched to a New Orleans Dixie lager with the remainder of our meal.  I liked it so much I went to the store and bought a sixer!  
The staff was so nice! The food - I guarantee (I hope you read that in your best Justin Wilson voice)
 And Get There EARLY because by the time we finished this place was packed and a line was going out the door!

Great fried chicken.  Crispy and not greasy -- perfectly cooked.  The sides are good, but not great.  I agree with another reviewer about the green beans -- they're ok but they put some ingredient in there that isn't quite right -- maybe sugar???

The etoufee is also very good.  Lesser favorites are the blackened meatloaf and the chicken cordon bleu.

Great comfort food and great, friendly service.

Lynn was our server and she was terrific. This was our first time to Cajun Yard Dog and it was a great experience. The chicken & seafood jambalaya was delicious and filling. The fried chicken was so delicious too.  Mac n' cheese makes a great side. If you get a dessert, try the bread pudding (so good). Great atmosphere and great people add to the wonderful experience at Cajun Yard Dog.

Change of ownership.   Maybe I caught them on a bad day.  They were having air conditioning issues and the restaurant was hot.  Most of the former employees were gone.  The food seemed to have dropped a notch in quality.  I will give them one more try.

Perfect joint if you're looking for a truely SOUTHERN REDNECK HANGOUT where the regular patrons are loud, rude, and vulgar. The wait staff have grungy fingers and hair and like to chat rather than wait tables. So if you have time to spare and don't mind redneck gawking as a past time, feel free to stand around and wait while the "regulars" drink, swear, and watch tv.
Why would anyone ever eat here?!
BTW - Lying about the number of stars is the only way to prevent honest negative reviews from becoming buried in cyberspace.

One of the worst meals I have ever eaten. We usually go to the Cajun Queen, but some friends wanted to try this place. I ordered the shrimp étouffée since I normally get the barbecue shrimp dinner or étouffée at the Queen and figured that would be a good pick. When it came out, it looked like can gravy was just poured all over the dish. That's pretty much what it tasted too...no spice, no flavor just blah. This was the first time I had to get something to eat after going to a restaurant. I will not be returning.

We have been to the other location at the arboretum and loved it.  Food is wonderful but the service was sloppy.  I'm hoping it's because they have only been open a few weeks and it will get better.  Check it out if you and you won't be disappointed!

When first going to the Cajun Yard dog, I thought that it was fantastic. I continued to go and notice that there was an inconsistency with the food; one day its good the next  day not so much. I notice especially with the side dishes, the collard greens are ALWAYS overcooked, the macaroni and cheese is always a different consistency.  When they fry things it's never cooked all the way though there are always uncooked parts of the batter that they use and on top of that they are moderately expensive for inconsistent food. I have decided its best that we part ways. Oh and the management is rude and never speaks to anyone. I will NOT be going back!

This place is too good not to shout about.  We waited about 20 minutes on Friday night around 5:50 for a table at this adorable restaurant that makes you feel like you are part of the family. Sat at the bar with friendly bartender, Graham seated us and consistently checked on us throughout the meal.  Lynn was our server, this woman works hard but still has time to talk to the regulars and make first timers feel welcome.  Then there is the food, the food is really good.  We started with the fried mushrooms and BBQ shrimp and grits.  The biggest, most delicate mushrooms we have ever had, accompanied with a homemade horseradish sauce.  The shrimp and grits were also amazing, we had to take over half of it home, because the portion was big.  We ordered the Crawfish Etouffee, the sauce was fantastic, the rice perfect (I prefer Crawfish when in season March - June) I think shrimp would have been a better choice, however my companion loved it.   The Chicken Cordon Bleu, was great.  Light crispy fried chicken, with Swiss, ham, and a sauce that was out of this world good.  I believe the owner/manager stopped to talk to everyone in the place, including us and was extremely friendly and bragged about the generous portions.  We will be enjoying our leftovers for lunch today and then hitting the gym to work it all off.  This is a great, casual, family dining place.  No frills, no pretension, just a Big Easy kind of place to grab great meal with great people.

We actually have a real cajun yard dog, and even she wouldn't eat the leftovers. Seriously, some of the worst cajun food on the planet. I've tried cajun food in many different cities and this stuff is bottom of the barrel, especially at these prices. 

If you like bland overcooked under-spiced cajun food, this is THE place to eat. I tried the Jambalaya. It came out mushy, very bland and had a strange orange-ish hue. Folks, Jambalaya is a dirty rice dish..Not supposed to be mushy, orange and certainly not bland.  

Charlotte needs a real cajun restaurant. So far all the available choices are underwhelming.

Brought my family here last week after finally choosing this place for my birthday night. Wow it impressed us. My dad loved his fried catfish strips, my mom ordered some fried oysters that were also delicious. The chicken my sister ordered came out fried to perfection. My girlfriend cleaned her plate of Blackened salmon and collared greens so I'm sure that was pretty good too! My meal, the seafood jambalaya, was just awesome. A big helping of crawfish, shrimp, chicken sausage, and mussels mixed together in Cajun rice was enough to fill any man up. The mac and cheese I chose as a side was good and deffinitely made from scratch. At the end of the meal the kind hostess offered us a free dessert to try and I chose the banana foster. It was tasty but a little runny. Not gunna complain though much, it was free! We all really enjoyed our meals and deffinitely will be back!

I really like this place, we were in North Carolina for a couple of days and wanted to find a southern ma' and pop' kind of place and this was exactly what we were looking for. Low prices and large delicious portions. Great find for us.

I love the theme of the restaurant, super cute. It's was lunch time, so it was a little wait, about ten minutes which wasn't bad. I had the chicken and seafood jambalaya with the smothered cabbage. It was amazing. I never had cheese in my cabbage, but it was surprisingly good. For desert I ordered the bread pudding with a side of ice cream. Amazing!!!!!!!! I will definitely be back to visit.

I grew up in Southern Louisiana so I have had a few authentic Cajun meals in my day.  By far, CYD has the best Gumbo in the City and I have tried most places that offer Gumbo.  When I say best, it's the closest to the dark roux southern Louisiana gumbo I remember.  The red beans and rice are good and the etouffee is excellent.  Prices are moderate.  From reading some of the reviews, it seems prices are being compared with McDonalds.  No they don't have a dollar menu.  Try Burger King.
Always ggreat!!  too small location so wait line can be long.  Been going to CYD for 13 years.

Ate at this restaurant and had the Po Boy fried shrimp sandwich with sweet potato fries. The sandwich lacked flavor and the sweet potato fries looked dehydrated, and tasted disgusting.  Did not live up to my expectations. Waste of money and will not be returning.

Waste our money. First the house style chips came to the table burn.  That should have been I clue to leave but we decided to stick it out and hope thing would improve; boy where we wrong. The food was BAD all around. My wife is from New Orleans so we know how the food should taste.  This place doesn't rate a one star. About the only item I would give just an OK to, is the shrimp and grits.  Dine at your risk. You been warned.

We truly enjoyed the food. We had oyster Po boy, Salmon, mahi mahi, étouffée and all of the meals were good. The dessert was kind of fun too beccause they had an eggnog pound cake. It's a casual restaurant with really good food and lots of options.

Pros - Red beans and rice, shrimp po' boy, fried okra, bread pudding, and RED OAK beer. 

Cons - Really bad live music.

Solid little joint serving good food and cold beer. Service has always been good as well.
Love it.  Fried Chicken, Mac/Cheese, Red Beans and Rice are wonderful.  Tough to get in.  Wish the restaurant was bigger!

Excellent food. We tried deviled eggs, Tobasco chicken, potato salad, coleslaw, jambalaya, grits. Shrimps were a little oily. The lemon pound cake was to die for!! On the whole a most satisfying meal for my kids & parents.

Easily my family's favorite restaurant to go to in Charlotte. Family's been weekly regulars for the better part of the last decade. I always try to hit the Dog when I'm town.

Everything I've ordered on the menu has been fantastic.

Being that I am from Louisiana... it was nice to finally get some Cajun food home away from home.

The food was OK, it isn't the BEST tasting cajun food. The food was a bit bland, but OK.

I loved their chocolate pecan pie! - I dont really like far stretched sweets... I like my sweets simple, but the pie was good!

The place was also a bit pricey for that little food but great customer service! Very sweet people and atmosphere. I'll come back for their live band on weekends!

Wow! Wow! Wow! So Amazing! Best Fried Chicken Ever! Best Service Ever! We love the food and the staff are always so friendly,respectful and helpful! 
A++++!!! Yum!
I can't believe it took me so long to give this place a try but omg! Everything I've tried since has been great but the fried chicken is some of the best I've ever had.

This place is about as authentic as you can get to New Orleans. It doesn't try to live up to its atmosphere. I can't tell if the people who own the place used to live in New Orleans, but they do act as if they do. I really hate to say that I believe that the place is authentic, as that its decorated with a few beads, and a "burbon street sign." However, the beer lights are authentic [had the new orleans feathers], and the LSU flags were dead on.  Given that it was authentic, the food and service is not fast. I'm not sure if its because the kitchen is slow or if they are meticulous. 

The food is simple. The place was packed [at lunch on a Monday]. The food had a small kick to it. The prices do seem a little high, but the portions are large. If you get a poboy, there will be a lot on your plate, enough for more than one meal. Additionally, given a no/low carb diet, you can ask for the rice&beans to be without the rice. Awesome! This place is comparable to my diet, close to where I work and live, and is close to average for a decent plate of food. I'm sold!

I had the catfish, and I liked it. I dinned with family members [who had never had Cajun food before] and they liked it as well.

Lastly: The TVs. Typically I abhor a television at a restaurant, but the sound was muted   and it didn't really take away from the atmosphere. People were happy to be here, liked the food, and were happy to be around each other.

We have been there a few times. It's one of those things that it's hard to find LA Cajun style food in this area. I find that this place is a hit and miss. The fish was under cooked this time, but it was seasoned well. The big problem that I had was that they charged for refill on sauces. Really? If it was outstanding, wouldn't mind paying those prices. So, we will keep searching for that delish Cajun seafood.

It is what it is I guess. I rolled with it all till the end but If you don't mind being rushed to order by a no patience, rather be somewhere else waitress(which you  have empathy with at first)  who brings you food and forks but no napkins and then seater who points out the  $18.00 dish he brought you is missing its side and he will bring it later but never does, and no ever comes and checks on you (so you never have a chance to remind anyone) and then this hurry up waitress leaves you waiting ten minutes for the to go box never asking how the meal was, then you catch the seater walking by  as we were putting the food in the to go box and let him know that he forgot our side,  his response was a glib  non apologetic do want some to go, I said hell no, now its about me saying "hell no" vs the bad service we received, i quickly apologized to the guy so I wouldn't have to smack him. then waited another 15 minutes for my credit card back. Food was ok, some sides were cold, don't know if they were meant to be(rice and beans-maybe?) So go there if you don't mind there expectation of you being an efficient customer(because they are busy), than receive inefficient service with cold overpriced missing food.

In Charlotte for a conference and wanted to try something different outside of the hotel. Service was great, food was good. The fried chicken was definitely on point and was some of the best I ever had, even me being from L.A.!  I really was craving jambalaya, but found theirs to be too wet and too salty for my taste. Mac n cheese was pretty flavorless, greens were good.

Best Po Boy in Charlotte, excellent catfish and sides also.

Awesome food, this is a hidden diamond

A punch and lots of flavor
One of my very favorite restaurants. Good food, friendly people, excellent service. Haven't had anything on the menu I didn't like and I've tried a lot of the menu!

Yum. Our fav restaurant in Charlotte, now in Fort Mill!  Maybe not as much character as the original location, but I'll settle for close to home and much more space. 

In our first visit to this location, we had great service and great food. What more could you ask for?  The manager/owner came around to check on tables which is a dying art in restaurants today. 

They always have wonderful specials, so definitely ask your server. And order the mac n cheese. Best in Charlotte!

First off, I'm not going to enter into a debate about authenticity.  Authentic to what?  To how your mom, your grandma, his grandma, my grandma makes it?  If you travel to New Orleans (or Rome, or Paris, or Hong Kong) you will find "authentic" food prepared hundreds of different ways.  

So, who cares?  Does the food taste good? That's what I care about and the food at the Cajun Yard Dog tastes good!

The restaurant is small and feels like the kind of place where after you visit a few times the wait staff gets to know you and you become a friend.  I love that.  The food (appetizer and entrees) arrived quickly, were correct and were delicious.  The waitress was friendly and kept our drinks filled.  She smiled pleasantly at our kids dropping noodles and fries on the floor.  She was a winner:)

All the items we ordered were great.  I am pretty sensitive to spicy food and my Shrimp and Grits were not spicy at all.  I realize that most expect food at Cajun establishments to be spicy.  If you like yours spicy, I am sure they will adjust the heat.  The mac n' cheese was so awesome.  I cannot imagine the calorie content, but it was stellar.

Personally, I can't wait to go back.
Authentic Cajun cuisine. Great atmosphere and great food. I went on a Monday night and watched the place fill up, I can't imagine what a Friday night looks like.

Love this joint in the Arboretum, uber casual eatery where you can count on a good po' boy NoLa style anyday. A favorite for a lazy Saturday lunch for us, a seat yourself kinda place most days, with a fair selection of microbrews for a place so small. Hot sauces abound at the bar (past what's on your table already), just ask the bartender to pass one over to you! Mac and Cheese side....yum! And plenty of other sides (lots like Okra, collards....) to choose from. The Gumbo the last time we were there? Delicious! This is a favorite of ours, make it one of yours too (just don't go when we need a table- ha!)

My very first visit to Cajun Yard Dog occurred soon after I returned to Charlotte, NC after a year in Miami, FL in 2005/2006. The eclectic decor was charming, definitely a conversation starter, like a visual story that got my imagination running.  On my first visit (pre-dinner), there was NO WAIT!!!  I sat at the bar even though there were available tables back in the day - the staff swears there are "No Wait" times that happen throughout the day currently, but I've never seen it myself :)  I had a glass of wine & the etouffee; I was hooked!!  I've NEVER had a bad meal there, not one single time!  As a matter of fact, the food is ALWAYS INCREDIBLE!!  Cooked and prepared to perfection consistently and with fresh ingredients - this applies to everything I've personally tried on the menu (to include specials on the board); appetizers, fish, sides & DESSERTS!!!  Anything fish at Cajun Yard Dog is my favorite...fried, blackened or grilled.  To date I haven't had a bad fish experience there & honestly I think that speaks volumes!!  On our most recent (but definitely not last) visit there about a week ago, I had the catfish bites, my partner had the trout and our guest (out of town from Ohio) had the redfish - ALL THREE DISHES WERE SCRUMPTIOUS!!!  We split a HEALTHY sized portion of Peach Cobbler that was "right out of the oven" and it was mouth wateringly divine!!!  Mind you, I haven't tried EVERYTHING on the menu, but I've probably come close after patronizing this restaurant for 9 years. 

For me and my partner, we choose to return to a restaurant because the food is amazing, but I must say the gang at Cajun Yard Dog is FANTASTIC, too and you'll want to come back to visit with them just as much as coming back for a delicious meal!!  Chances are you might find yourself soon conversing about kids going off to college with the wait staff after a few visits!!

I've read a few reviews here today about Cajun Yard Dog and frankly was a tad bit surprised about how some people make it personal; one claiming it was a redneck hangout, a few reviewers felt the need to point out the staffs hair (something along the lines of not being perfectly in place), fingers or they way the staff appears as if they want to be somewhere else.  I've worked in the food service industry - it's a demanding job and all I have to say about that is "THANK YOU STAFF" for working your butts off and making this NON-CHAIN, NONCONFORMING little slice of yummy paradise a gem!!!  I don't give a damn if your hair isn't perfect and though you didn't expect to have to work 4 or more doubles/split shifts in a row...you did anyway and not only did you do it, but you were AWESOME while doing it!!!  Hell, I KNOW I secretly daydream of being off in a place far, far away from reality at times - sometimes I even dared to daydream while I was at WORK (especially if I'm having a crap week).  I think it's pretty hilarious, too, that a restaurant would be judged / rated on whether or not they serve alcohol; I go to a restaurant to eat, not to have a "Hurricane" frou-frou drink. 

Cajun Yard Dog is UNIQUE and is NOT your typical pretentious / "Charlotte-Stepford Style" / let's keep up with Jones' / where to be seen local "hot spot for the minute" kind of place - THANK GOODNESS!!!  Cajun Yard Dog has substance, heart & soul - the quality of the food and the staff sees to that.  Guess that's why they've been around a while!!

Already dreaming of our next visit :)

I almost don't want to write this review because I want to keep it a secret. This place is a hidden gem in south Charlotte. You cannot go wrong with anything you order but a few of the must try items are the blackened meatloaf, chicken cordon blue and gumbo. They have a great portion sizes. Unless you go really early or really late you will have to wait for a table but it is work the wait.
Amazing. This place rocked. Definitely fair priced and everything was cooked perfectly

We have been in Charlotte just over 2 years and love to try new restaurants every time we go out but we love CYD and go frequently enough that we have become recognized regulars by Keith, the best server ever!  Between the food and Keith's fun serving style, it's easily our favorite spot in the area!  Whenever we have visitors, CYD is always on the list of things to show them, and have yet to have anyone not love it!  The shrimp and grits, jambalaya and mac and cheese are amazing! The owner always makes the rounds checking on each table which is a nice personal touch.  The decor is fun Mardi Gras style.  It's not a fancy spot but if you're looking for good food, fun servers and fun atmosphere, you absolutely can't go wrong here!

My husband and I ate at Cajun Yard Dog for the first time tonight. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, and the service was excellent. The owner or manager ( he sounded like a true Ragin' Cajun'!) checked on us several times while we were eating. My husband had the Shrimp Ettoufe with mac and cheese, and was very happy with the entire meal. I had the barbeque shrimp (not really barbeque, but in  butter w Cajun seaoning), the smothered cabbage and fried okra. Everything was very tasty. The only reason I did not give the Yard Dog a 5 is because my cabbage was not hot and barely warm. We had the chocolate pecan pie and sweet potato pound cake for dessert- yum for both! Not an inexpensive meal, but a real treat.

I had only eaten at the Arboretum location once and it was excellent. On our only other attempt, we left because the wait was so long. How sweet it is to have them right down the road from us now, with plenty of convenient parking!

Don't recall our waitress's name, but she did a good job without being overbearing. We went before the dinner crowd and were seated immediately.
 
The fried green tomato appetizers were excellent; fresh, crisp and not greasy. I had blackened meatloaf, smashed potatoes, and collard greens. Wife had crab cake, smothered cabbage and mac/cheese. All was excellent, just the way I remembered from the Arboretum location, without the bumper to bumper traffic.

The beer selection was very good, although they had sold out of Dixie Blackened Voodoo. No problem though, as they had a number of very good local and national craft brews to choose from. They had a number of wines to choose from, but I don't know much about wine. 

Ambience was pleasant for a strip mall restaurant which just opened a couple of weeks ago, but we didn't go for ambience, we went for a good, reasonably priced dinner. We were not disappointed.
Awesome crab cakes!!!!  Getting 4 stars only due to a tiny waiting area and a lengthy wait at times. Call ahead
Absolutely love this place, best Cajun food in town. We drive almost 45 minutes to go eat here because it's completely worth it.

Let me start off by saying that my only reason for giving Cajun Yard Dog 4 out of 5 stars is that they do not offer beignets.  And honestly I have only found one Cajun restaurant, not located in Louisiana, that offered beignets.  I feel like they are a staple of Cajun cuisine.  Ok, rant aside, the restaurant is small, and they do not have a hostess that greets you and takes your name if there is a wait.  When you arrive and walk in there is a yellow pad of paper sitting on an entry table that you add your name to and the number in your party.  It's best to arrive early if you do not want to wait to be seated.  We did not know this when we arrived and there were about six parties ahead of us, however, we chose to wait as our mouths were watering for some Cajun/creole.  And we were so glad we did!  Our waitress was very sweet and attentive.  I ordered the chicken and andouille jambalaya, my husband had the red beans and rice and my father ordered the blackened mahi.  By the time we sat down and ate it was late and the waitress returned to the table to explain that they were out of mahi but could substitute tilapia.  He was not at all disappointed by the substitution.  In addition to our entrees we were each given the option of two sides.  I had the fried okra and the green beans.  The okra was delicious and I assume they must have used the same batter that they use on their fried chicken that all the yelpers talk about.  Delicious.  And the green beans were spot on, cooked perfectly keeping their bright green color while still having a little crunch.  Mixed in with the green beans were slivered almonds, if you have a nut allergy be sure to mention it as it does not indicate that the dish contains nuts on the menu.  The restaurant is decorated with Louisiana flare making you feel like you are in a café on Bourbon Street.  The noise level is high, which is not unexpected given the size.  There is a bar with seating for approximately 9, if you don't care to wait for a table keep an eye open for space at the bar.  The restaurant also offers carry out!  Happy to have found a little slice of Louisiana in Charlotte.  We will surely return.
Love the oyster po-boy and the fried green tomato po-boy! The smothered cabbage is amazing. Great seasonal beers and Abita Turbodog always on tap.
Everything we had was good-jambalaya, po boy and catfish. Service was also prompt and knowledgeable.

Had a great New Orleans theme that matched the theme of their food.  The Crab Cake po boy and shrimp n grits were great.  The place was packed and had maybe 20 tables and a bar area.  We were dissapointed only in we were looking for New Orleans food since my wife is from New Orleans.  The red beans n rice and the gumbo did not pass the test for her.  The cajun spices just were not there.  Great place for a local that just wants to have a nice dinner,  we would have to do take out in the future as there is not enough room to wait outside with a big party if we brought family from out of town.

This place is OUTSTANDING, and Al the owner always takes the time to say hi. My favorite is the 'Shrimp and Andouille Sausage' I add crawfish to it, its off the hook! It's tough not getting the fried catfish or chicken. The only thing wrong with this place is I want to eat it everything on the menu!
Come start the new year off right with a healthy salad! This one I got topped with jumbo BBQ shrimp and it out if this world!

Not impressed. Went there for lunch on Saturday with the family based on a recommendation from a friend. We got the jambalaya, the blackened meatloaf, and the shrimp, all of which were disappointing. The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't good and certainly lacked the Cajun feel and spice that we were looking for. I've had better jambalaya from a frozen California Pizza Kitchen bag from the grocery store. Would not recommend!

The food is alright but they give so little. Had the chicken jambalaya the second time and it was a lot smaller than before. Maybe half the size as before.. we came both lunch times so portions should have been the same.

So excited to see one of our favorite restaurants here in Fort Mill. The food is great just like the other location. However, the service could stand to be improved. We have been here three times and each time we came in service was slow. The last time we came in three people standing behind the bar, three tables needing to be cleaned. We sat down at one table only to realize that it needed to be wiped off also. Thank goodness the food here is so fantastic.

This place is absolutely delicious. I've been many times and have never had a bad experience. The staff is her fun and friendly and the food is absolutely delicious. Make sure to ask for it spicy if you want a little kick!

We would go to the Arboretum location but it was a little far for us so when we found out they were opening up the Fort Mill location, I was super happy!  We went yo the Fort Mill location hoping it would be as good as their original location and IT WAS!!  I had the Chicken & Seafood Jambalaya and the hubs had Crawfish Etoufee - both delicious.  We finished our meal off with Blueberry & BlackBerry Cobbler.  Happy - happy!!

We actually traveled like 45 min to eat here.. I'll give it a 2 only bc our fish was hot... nothing to write home about. Overpriced and the sides were baby size. The fry was good on the catfish. Won't be going back.. service wasn't the best either

Good food, fun New Orleans cajun music playing and attentive service.  All spicy items can be served not blackened, salmon was a good choice.  Fries are not the best, too dark and not crispy, however, mac and cheese spiral noodles were tasty, the greens were spot on almost dare say best ever with bits of bacon and extra fresh and flavorable.  Shrimp combo was delicious, the shrimp was in a golden crisp batter, this will definately be a reason to return.  Several made on site desserts, including bread pudding, chocolate pecan pie and several other temptations.

My husband and I finally tried this place after having it Bookmarked for years. 
I will have to say we were SURPRISED and far from disappointed. I am giving this place a 4 star rating because I personally couldn't eat much as it was still my first trimester of my pregnancy and my tastebuds were off but my husband and I have similar taste so I know that my pregnancy was causing some of my taste to be off plus I was still at the point of not holding food down and just experimenting to see what I can get with. 
We ordered several apps and our server suggested the house made yard sauce which I mixed with the sauce that came with the fried oysters per her suggestion and man did it fix my tastebuds with all the food I ate (yum yummy sauce).
After eating apps my husband noticed a chicken fried over at another table that the man seemed to have inhaled so he asked our server about it and was told that it's their number one seller. My husband immediately ordered it and the server let him know that it would take 20-25 minutes or more as it's cooked fresh and he was okay with that.
The chicken arrived looking so wonderfully crisp and he and my son dived in and ate it down to the bone. My husband says it was the best fried chicken he has had since we moved to NC and he has been talking about returning for a long time now so we may have to make the trip over really soon.
My only hang up about this place is the lack of compassion for those who don't eat pork. I mean I have Louisiana roots and even in Louisiana there are options to not have pork adolli or pork included in gumbo, etoufee, etc.. Those options are limited here as my family are none pork eaters and recently I have become vegetarian20%/Vegan 80% so I'm not sure I'll be able to eat anything here the next visit I'll be there to take pictures of my husband food and take his opinions to heart.

Made Pre call way in advance to get a party Catered...was told call on Wednesday before our Saturday event.
Called on that Wednesday and then was told" oh we can't do the catering"
Really left us hanging.
What Losers... Never even think of giving them a big order...you will regret it.

The place is really as good as it gets.  If you like your food a little on the spicy side and enjoy a laid back but cool setting you should give this place a try.  I mean seriously, everything on the menu is fantastic.  They have everything Cajun/creole, from seafood dishes to red beans and rice.  It's a pretty small place so if you have a big group you might want to call ahead, but if you're looking for a nice place to hang out or even a romantic place to take your significant other give this place a try.

Fresh house-made salad dressings, warm and crisp fried oysters, and tasty fish!  The food is fantastic, the atmosphere fun, and the service is friendly.  My friend and I have had 2 fun ladies' lunches here and we will keep coming back.  I bring the little guy and he LOVES the cheesy grits and okra!!!

Food was good, bartender/owner? was awesome &very helpful .
Haven't gotten a chance to visit New Orleans or Mardi Gras this place is cute and decorated so festive...feel like your there!
Little kick in almost everything but great!
Gumbo full of chicken & some sausage.
Catfish with panko breading tasty.
Okra great, shocked it was frozen!
Jambalaya with chicken & sausage...could use more sausage but yummy.
Mac & cheese creamy good & slight kick.
Red beans & rice awesome!

Bananas foster was perfect!

Will come back, so much more to try!!

Oh only beer & wine  no liquor
Great food, no matter whatcha get. (Try the smothered cabbage if you haven't yet!!) The staff is always friendly and attentive. Get there early cause it gets packed!

The blackened meatloaf was very tough and rubbery. My friend ordered oysters (or clams) and was pleased. I've eaten here only about 5 times and the other meals I have had were good. Stay away from the meatloaf though.

Well, first the sanitation rating is 90%. The wait list is sign your self in. Definitely a first. Very friendly casual environment. The tables are so close that the waitress kept bumping me. 

Our waitress was very friendly and engaging. 

Ordered fried green tomatoes for apps. Delish. 

Entree it all went to hell. Ordered the Chicken Cordon Blue. It was more like fried chicken with a slice of ham slapped on top with some kind of cheese corn sauce. It looked and tasted unappealing. The waitress was very accommodating and switched out my meal for seafood gumbo. The seafood was OK but the rioux was salty. 

It was a packed restaurant so obviously, i got the wrong meal! would go back and try something different.

3 stars for the friendly waitress and owner that came around to tables to check on customers.

Possibly the worst service that I've ever had. This used to be one of my favorite restaurants years ago, but what I understand is New Management,and it has gone to the dogs. The last three times I was there I actually got up and left in the middle of my meal. I kept going back because I hoped so much that it was just single bad experience and it would improve. It has not. There are many great restaurants in Charlotte, there is no reason to risk another major disappointment and such absolutely terrible service

Had lunch Togo there the other day. The portion was good and the homemade sauce was bomb.  I definitely want to bring my family here to dine in for dinner.  The only issue I had was with the soda it was sorta flat.  Other than that I'm glad to have a new place to eat!
Ate here the other day.  Greeted as soon as I opened the door.   Got a appetizer and a beer.   BBQ shrimp was cooked right and the beer was cold.    Staff is attentive and friendly will be back.

A hidden gem in the Arboretum. Go here regularly for the fresh fish. Lots of sides to choose from- everything is always excellent. Try  and get there early- they fill up fast and the wait can take awhile.

Best place in town to get REAL New Orleans food!! Went to one at Arboretum but happy to have one closer to home. Hubby & I like to stop by for a Blackened Voodoo Lager & a Po Boy. Our server Michael was great.
One of the best places on South charlotte. The blackened meatloaf is awesome . The fried chicken is the best in town!

Visited Cajun Yard Dog tonight and had a wonderful meal - fried oysters with fries and smothered cabbage. Absolutely delicious! There were five in our party, and the others had fried chicken, catfish, shrimp and grits, and blackened meat loaf topped with shrimp (poor man's surf and turf). Everyone was very pleased with their meals. So happy to have this relatively new place in the neighborhood!

Was a great place to go to, but unfortunately, the food has been very inconsistent over our past 4 or 5 visits and the expertise that use to exist at the restaurant has moved on to other establishments.  May go back in a few months to see if they can fix the problems.

I had lots of anticipation coming here, I love Cajun food. Owner and staff were very friendly. However, food came up a little short. It needed more spice and more flaire. The mac n cheese, my bellweather, was tasteless and cold. They salted and chilled my beer glass - not what a craft beer drinker wants. The creole was good, but lacked spice and kick. Shrimp was good. I will try again.

It's been a while since we have been to CYD and boy do I miss this place.  We had the fresh catch of the day;  blackened swordfish and the special entree; 2 salmon/goat cheese grit cakes w/ blackened shrimp.  These 2 meals had awesome flavor and good size portions.  We also chose several side items beets, okra, jalapeño deviled eggs as an appetizer.  We will be back soon.

Ordered the catfish sandwich that was recommended by the waitress and the bread was too thick, the sandwich was dry, The fries were oily as hell and little they look like they were fries remains. What I ever go back? No. The atmosphere was nice but I wouldn't go back...my first time and it wasn't a great experience.
We went here tonight for some po'boys and couldn't be happier with the restaurant.  Service was great, food was just like what we had in Cajun country.  Highly recommend this place!
My wife & I have had dinner and drinks here a couple of times and have loved the food. The menu has a nice selection and everything has been great so far.

One of my favorites in Charlotte!  You will find fantastic southern fare and seafood & delicious authentic cajun dishes here.  I never leave disappointed...or without eating way too much.  A few of my favorite dishes: the pimiento cheese and pickled beets appetizer is incredible.  I'd never be one to order pickled beets but they're awesome and the pimiento cheese is perfect.  There are great sandwich selections (shrimp po' boys, catfish, fried chicken ....) but my favorites are the platters.  You'll get a huge helping of your choice of fried oysters, shrimp, chicken, blackened mahi...the list of mouthwatering choices goes on and on...and then you also get a choice of two yummy southern-style sides.  Mac n' cheese, collards, smothered cabbage, sweet potato fries....seriously it will take you a hot minute to decide between all the menu choices.  Lucky for us, there's a pick two platter option if you can't choose between fried oysters and blackened mahi--yes please!  I'm always part of the clean plate club here, so I've only been able to try dessert twice (pretty sure I was pregnant both times!) but no surprise it was amazing.  Loved the bread pudding with bourbon sauce and their pecan pie.

The atmosphere is fun--a small restaurant with tons of New Orleans gear hanging everywhere--beads, alligators, beer signs, etc.  The staff is extremely friendly and helpful.  I've never had to wait more than a few minutes before someone comes over to take drink orders.  There's a good beer selection and a fun bar with sports channels.  Nothing goes better with some friend oysters than a nice cold beer and some SEC football!  There is limited seating, so it can be tough during the busiest dinner hours.  But remember, good things come to those who wait!

I recently moved to Charlotte from L.A. and was looking for a good spot in my new neighborhood.  My son and I saw the yellow sign and walked in.  This was a month and a half ago.  Since then, we've been back at least 4 times.  I could go every week..but my son wants to "eat healthy."  Yeah...good for you.  The staff is always friendly..personable....with the charm that I didn't find that often at L.A. Restaurants.   

The first meal I had was the fried catfish with jalapeño tartar sauce and greens and potato salad.  Loved the catfish..the greens were pretty good and the salad was okay...a little too much mayo though.  Since then I've had the blackened mahi...it was just okay.  I think it could have used a bit more seasoning.  Every time I've gone, I've seen people eating the fried chicken.  Finally yesterday, I tried it.  I'm a dark meat person.  It was great! I had a leg and a thigh.  The seasoning was just right...the crunch was...crunchy.  I had to tell the waitress how much I enjoyed .  She said they have a to go box.  You can call in advance..it'll take 1/2 hour or so.  Great to know...because I'm always at the Arboretum

I know what I'm doing this Mardi Gras.  They have big Mardi Gras celebration (duh!)..crawfish boil...possible alligator meat.  The waitress said its a busy, fu time. I can't wait. 

One last thing...on our first visit..one of the daily dessert specials was a cobbler...I forget which one.  My son ordered.  It was HUGE!  Big enough for 3-4 people.  I don't like cobbler so it was left to him to try to eat after his meal.  I wish the waiter had told us that it was for sharing.  Needless to say, my son couldn't finish and he's a big 21 year old.  It came with ice cream..so couldn't take home.  

After all is said and done, Cajun Yard Dog is our fav neighborhood place to eat..and will be my go to place for out of town visitors.

The food is really good, esp. the beans & rice. The bread pudding is good & enough for two. The moscato wine is good. My biggest complaint is that one of the female servers always looks as if she'd rather be anywhere but at work. And she always looks that way. She's a long-time employee & if she reads this she knows who she is. Cheer up, you bring people down!

There are lots of other comments here in reviews that describe the Yard Dog. I've always enjoyed the food here (whether it's "authentic" or not). There for a while it was taking too long to be served to make this a lunch spot during work week. But lately, the service has been much faster. We've been able to get in and out in 45-50 minutes. I work nearby and with all of the restaurants in the area this one stays on the list. Get there early (e.g., 11:30) and you'll get a good seat. Wait much longer during the week and it will fill up. Shrimp and Grits are excellent.

I just wish they would bring back the biscuits.
Excellent food!  Tried the blackened meatloaf, crab cakes, and fried green tomatoes. All were very good.  We will be back.

After trying Cajun Yard Dog for the first time yesterday I am even more convinced that I don't love Cajun food. I think I have tried every Cajun food place in Charlotte and each time I leave dissatisfied. Yesterday was no different. I was certainly underwhelmed by the food. 

The atmosphere was cozy and a little over the top tacky but in an entertaining way. My guest and I sat at a corner table. No one puts Baby in a corner! Sorry I just had a Dirty Dancing flashback.  I was fine sitting in the corner. 

We were greeted immediately which was nice and the waitress was more than happy to give us the rundown of the menu and her personal favorites. She did not like the Etoufee. Oh that's not a good sign. My intention was to order the Etoufee. Now what?

I had the Fried Oysters and I will say this, they were probably the BEST Fried Oysters I ever had! The coating was DELISH! Light, crispy and non greasy. I could have pigged out on the oysters alone and would have left very happy. The only problem was there were only 6. I personally would have liked a few extra on the plate. The big disappointment came with the sides. Fried Okra (hello, one of my favorite veggies!) and Red Beans and Rice. Doesn't get anymore Cajun then that. The Okra was over fried and VERY GREASY. Yuck! The Red Beans and Rice was equally disappointing. It was very bland and they were luke warm.  

For what we got I felt the price was high especially for lunch. 6 oysters, Red beans and rice, Fired Okra and a club soda, $15.80 before tip.  A little steep IMO. Throw a dozen oysters on the plate and then I will gladly pay the $$.
Loved the catfish and fried shrimp.  Mac & cheese was like that from the family reunion - so good!

I highly recommend Cajun Yard Dog. I honestly consider it to be the best Cajun food in charlotte, even better than Cajun queen. The service is very attentive. The menu is authentically Louisiana, complete with abita root beer(the best) and abita beers. The vibe is casual and energetic. I had the fried oyster po boy and it was great! Shrimp and grits were also excellent. I can't wait to come back and try out more of the menu!

Good, not great. For starters, the place needs some cheer. It is very dark inside and kind of drab. Add some lighting and it would be more inviting. We came for a late lunch and spent $40 easily excluding tip, so a little pricey for lunch.  The okra is very tasty- light and not overly greasy. Kids meal options are slim, but you get good portions. The dessert looked good, but did not want to hit $50 for, again, lunchtime.  Despite our server being over assigned to multiple tables, she did a pretty good job. On a few instances, we had to remind her of a missing item/request. We would go back, but not a weekly type of place for the costs.

Wow great place and a great Cajun vibe. I've only had the shrimp and seafood jambalaya dish, but it was awesome! The only thing is the pricing. The menu that is on here with yelp must be an old one because there is about a $7 difference on site!! I paid roughly $20 for the jambalaya dish!! But great place, only thing negative is it is a little pricy for what you get

So I decided I would check off one of my bookmarks...Cajun Yard Dog wasn't too far from my location, so I headed over. It's located in Arboretum shops...literally next door to Michael's. The location is small, busy and loaded with aromas. My server Lynne was very friendly and enthusiastic! She talked me into a strawberry Abita (very good) and an appetizer. I have no clue how I agreed to try the deviled eggs, but that menu item was NOT "eggs-cellent"! Something's missing from the mixture. There was no flavor and they are just blah on a plate! At least they were cold...I had to chip the ice off! 
I ordered the catch of the day, swai topped with a cream sauce of crawfish and shrimp. My two sides: mac-n-cheese and fried okra.  The fish was cooked perfectly! Very tender and flavorful. The cream sauce was delicious and the shellfish wasn't overcooked. The mac-n-cheese was spiraled pasta, made with a bechemel and cheddar cheese. I could taste the butter in the pasta which makes the flavor pop! The okra was fried crispy just how I like it. I even rolled a few pieces in the cream sauce.  Price wise, you're looking to spend $30 (app, drink & entree).  There's no liquor, just beer and wine. The location is small, so to avoid a wait, go at an off peak time.

I often venture into Arboretum for a range of miscellaneous reasons and one day, I noticed Cajun Yard Dog. What does Cajun Yard Dog even mean? Does it matter? No, not really, but it definitely caught my eye. To me the name said simple, very casual and authentic. I bookmarked it immediately vowed to come back and see how it upholds to my beloved, Cajun Queen.

My cousin was visiting from California and we were yelping through Charlotte trying to figure out where to eat for dinner. I mentioned that I've been meaning to try Cajun Yard Dog just because the name is just so random and cool. That was enough reason for him and let me tell you, BEST life decision ever. We ordered fried oysters, deviled eggs, gumbo, fried green tomatoes, fried chicken, fried fish and much much more. The madness does not stop for fat kids. How do you judge how amazing a place is on the amazingness scale? It is how guilty you feel after every bite yet you still finish every single thing you ordered!

I've been back maybe 10 times since that first visit and Cajun Yard Dog never fails me. If I HAD to recommend a few dishes to you, it would have to be the Crawfish Etoufee, Shrimp & Grits and the Blackened Whatever the Fish of the Day is. I've had the fish of the day three times and every single time, it was AMAZING. Squeeze the slightest bit of lemon on there and viola! PERFECTION. The Crawfish Etoufee is steaming of flavor in every bite and they are mighty generous with the amount of crawfish you get (and for $10!). If you don't get the shrimp & grits, you HAVE to get the cheese grits as a side along with the Green Bean Almondine. No idea what kind of wizardry goes on in the kitchen, but I am beyond addicted to Cajun Yard Dog! The food is amazing. The staff has that southern hospitality that makes you feel just at home and the prices are RIDICULOUS.. ridiculously CHEAP! See this is where I'm conflicted. As much as I love Cajun Queen, the prices are steep! Cajun Yard Dog gives me the authenticity, the quality and the bang for my buck. Let's just say I've cheated on my beloved CQ quite a bit nowadays.

Side note: I recommend going for lunch instead of dinner. The portion sizes between lunch and dinner aren't significantly different, but the prices definitely are! Lunch prices are about $10 or less and dinner prices are close to $20. I have to admit that even though I know this, I still came back for dinner once because I couldn't get the yard dog cravings out of my system and the next day was Sunday (the only day that they're closed)! Not my fault, I was trapped.

This is one of the best spots in town.  The atmosphere is fun and entertaining. 
The staff is friendly and the food is phenomenal!
Tasty doesn't begin to describe it. 

As far as price goes, you'll save a heap and not go home hungry for lunch!
The gumbo is fabulous and the mac and cheese is a definite yum!

Excellent service.  They gave a sample of the mac n cheese to our daughter to see if she'd like it; we all did.  The nightly special Two Step Bayou over dirty rice was awesome.  We highly recommend Cajun Yard Dog

Recent open, but not great and pricey 

Bartender seemed engaged, but is poorly trained and no knowledge of the food, heritage, etc

Lots of Hispanics trying to cook Cajun 

Good music

One of my favorite places in town. I always come on a  Saturday and get the chicken & waffles. Well actually I get a double order of chicken. And judging by the reaction of the staff, I'm the only one who orders double. 

In doing so I had the pleasure of meeting and talking to the chief a few times. I will continue to come here for a long time. I couldn't be more pleased with the service and the quality of food. Small restaurant with great staff and spectacular food.

I have also had the fresh mahi one evening, absolutely wonderful as well.

Thanks 
From the Guy who gets double chicken

Absolutely love this restaurant!! One of my favorite places to eat in SC. There's two locations both have great friendly staff and laid back atmosphere. Good for fresh seafood and craft beers. My go to dishes are the seafood gumbo (which is done the correct way) collards, catfish tenders, and calamari. Huge portions and also a good place to bring the family.

I am still a fan of the Cajun Yard Dog, but on my most recent visit, I did notice a couple of things that have gone downhill...which is why I dropped to 3 stars instead of 4 stars as in my previous review.  

For starters, the place really needs to expand a bit...either with more regular table seating or a bigger bar that will accommodate more people. The wait times are just getting really long based on my last couple of visits. 

Most recently, we arrived between 6-6:15 on a Friday, and had a 45-55 minute wait for a table.  This wouldn't be too terribly bad if there was sufficient room at the bar, or in the "waiting area" but neither is the case.   My S.O. had suggested we leave and go somewhere else, but I was really craving some Cajun food.  So he was a good sport, and agreed to wait. 

When we were finally seated, we pretty much knew what we were going to order.  To start, we had an order of calamari.  I would not order this again. Our order was made up of less than 1/2 calamari and the rest was just the breaded fried okra and breaded fried onion. A little of that would be ok, but I would have liked to see more calamari.  On the plus side, I don't normally love rémoulade,  but the stuff they served along with the calamari & okra was very tasty. 

So, for my entrée, I got the usual - shrimp etoufee with fried okra on the side. Usually this is my favorite combination... but honestly, they were just a bit off tonight. 1) If I had known how much fried okra they included in the appetizer, I would have ordered a different side item. 2) the Fried Okra was not as delicious as usual... it was a bit flat - it tasted sort of like the frozen stuff I buy at the grocery store. And 3) my biggest disappointment was my entrée.  Usually, the etoufee is super flavorful, and very generous portion size. This time, my plate was full of rice, but the etoufee itself was a bit on the sparse side and not as flavorful as normal. I hope this is an anomaly, and that next time the quality & quantity is back up to par. 

Our service was a-ok, considering how swamped they were. Oh, and kudos for the beer menu  - they always have a nice selection of different beers on the board.

The hubby and I were searching for a new restaurant to try out for a quick lunch and we ended up at Cajun Yard Dog.  The place is a little small but quaint.  The ambiance was relaxed and casual with a seat yourself approach at the front door.  The menu offered plenty of tasty cajun options including the standard jumbalaya and po' boy sandwiches.  I enjoyed the fact that they had a long list of classic southern sides to choose from on the menu (however corn bread, one of my favorites at cajun restaurants, is not included in this list).  I ordered the pimento grilled cheese sandwich with a side of collard greens.  My meal was delicious.  The pimento cheese had quite a kick to it and my nose was running by the end of the meal.  My husband ordered the seafood jumbalaya.  He's long been in search for the best jumbalaya in Charlotte and has ordered it at several restaurants only to be disappointed.  He actually seemed to enjoy it at this restaurant even though it was served with mussels which is usually outside of his seafood range.  
The service was decent despite the fact that only one waitress was serving the entire restaurant by herself.  I liked that I was able to get a to-go cup for my tea when we were leaving.  It made up for the fact that they didn't offer splenda in their repertoire of sweeteners on the table.

Ok..I am from Charlotte actually Matthews...why in the world I haven't been here before is beyond me. Outstanding crawfish and shrimp pasta. Great craft beer..great service..cool atmosphere. We missed the line at the door but I know why it was there. I will be back many more times with friends. Yahay..for me finding this place! !!

Finally made it in to Cajun Yard Dog! This place can be a bit tricky with getting a table! Quaint inside, popular for sports fans and great food can pack out the inside in no time flat. My wife and I ventured in for an early-ish dinner on a Saturday night. 

The menu houses a phantasmagorical array of Cajun choices. Etouffe, jambalaya, seafood....all choices apropos for the bayou-seeking culinaries. 

First, we ordered a few drinks and an app. Great beer choices. Red Oak from outside of Greeensboro, and Abita root beer. If you haven't had Abita's root beer, you must. It's incredibly flavorful and not overtly laden with sassafras. The house-made chips are wondrously prepared. A little more done than most, served with herb sour cream and a BBQ cream. The BBQ cream is faint and sweet and the herb is much more pungent.

My wife ordered a menagerie of side items. Veggies, Mac n' cheese, fried okra and jalapeno cheese grits...oh, those grits. They are incredibly creamy and packed with flavor(s). All were fantastic. 

I had the chicken jambalaya. A HEAPING plate of jambalaya packed with chicken, smoked summer sausage, rice, spices and a brilliant sauce. Each bite is packed with that roux-y, tomatoe-y, spicy sauce and the chicken/sausage chunks in each bite are subtle and plentiful. The level of spice is manageable for anyone, in my opinion. Not over the top but definitely enough for you to recognize throughout the meal. There was so much of it, I had to take most of it home!  

Prices are fair and the service was great. Next time, have to try the desserts!

So happy with this quaint, festooned with Mardi Gras accoutrement, Cajun joint! Can't wait to go back!

This place is amazing. My mother in law took me here for lunch one day and I have a seafood allergy, but the staff and cooks took great care of me. They told me the foods that I should stay away from and told me that they would cook my food separately so I wouldn't have a reaction. I know it was hard with all of the seafood but thank you for taking great care of me :) We will definitely be back.

Amazing! Tops the two day trip to New Orleans. Catch of the day was swordfish, my wife had that and Tabasco marinated catfish fritters, I had the chicken and seafood jambalaya. Sides were mac and cheese. 
Price was perfect and for the first time I didn't need to season my food no salt or sauces like I normally do. 
Owner was working lunch and I always respect a restaurant that the owner takes pride and works to keep quality and service up. 
Live in Boone NC but will be back!

We were greeted by a very nice young lady. Service was great! We ordered Shrimp Po boy sandwich. They were ok, not special just ok! My daughter had shrimp etoufe! That was pretty good! So food was ok! But when I go to a restaurant I expect the restrooms to be clean. No paper towels, no hand soap! To me that's disgusting! I could see the kitchen from the restrooms and the kitchen was very dirty! Food all over the floor!
The prices are a bit high but the food is great. The blackened meatloaf is excellent.

We had dinner here for the first time last night -- and it won't be the last. The fried mushroom starter was delicious -- prepared very well and not greasy. We followed that with the chicken cordon bleu. The chicken was crispy and the sauce was a creamy wonderful surprise. The portion was very generous. We followed with a fabulous blackberry cobbler served with ice cream and whipped cream. From start to finish, the meal was delicious, the service attentive, and the owner went the extra mile to ensure that we were enjoying our meal.
Mm mac and cheese is so delish and creamy. Their jambalaya is great and the service is 8/10.

This was our sixth visit and thought it was time for a review. On previous visits the fish special and sides have been......OUTSTANDING! Last night I enjoyed the Red Fish special. Despite a small portion, the fish was seasoned perfectly, moist and full of flavor. The entree included fried green tomatoes which were crisp and tasty. My other side, the collard greens were.......Amazing! Service was very good, as usual. On previous visits, Etouffee has been inconsistent based on how busy the CYD is on that particular night. When the house is full my four stars can slip to just two. Sides never disappoint with the Jalapeno Deviled Eggs and Smothered Cabbage joining the greens as a must try! Last night, before 6:00, was a five star experience!

1/14/17 Tried the fried chicken and it was some of the best I ever eaten! Crispy and well breaded while remaking very juicy. These guys know what their doing when it come to their chicken! And the side......see the comments above.
This place is enjoyable, but it's not the best cajun food I've ever had. I've been twice and had the shrimp and grits and the catfish po' boy. Both were decent. That's about all I can say about it.
Consistently good food.  I really like the fried chicken. The restaurant is TINY so if there are diners waiting then you may wait for a while.
Food was delicious! I got the chicken and rice jambalaya and macaroni and cheese. Macaroni and cheese was so delicious I got a second order. Will definitely be back!

Friends introduced us to the yard dog and omg, I am in love.  Amazing food, amazing service, fried green tomatoes were a hit with the hubby who never had them before...the fried catfish is absolutely perfect, beautifly flavorful, and juicy inside with a battered outside which wasn't greedy in the least bit.   The green beans almondine, were to die for.   I could deff see us becoming regulars.  Amazing, absolutely amazing.  Brought me back to time spent in nola

This place is always amazing. They are always packed so be sure not to come too hungry. The place is pretty small. However, the food is worth the wait. Today I had the fried shrimp and bbq shrimp. It was really good. The cabbage is to die for!

If you are looking for a nice quiet place to have dinner, this is not it. However, if you are looking for good New Orleans food with a loud and fun environment, this is the place. The restaurant is very unique, and the staff are always really friendly.

Also, if you are looking for mixed drinks and a full bar, this is not the place, but if you are looking for really cool beer that you can't find anywhere else and an assortment of wine, this is your place. I absolutely love coming here.

This place could be mistaken for a fried food Louisiana sports bar... But it is much more than that.  This is most likely the best quality food in the area.  The right mix of authentic with their own twist will keep you coming back.

Our Fried catfish bites came out hot, fresh, and perfectly seasoned and prepared.  If you order smashed potatoes ask for the gravy.  I ordered blackened meatloaf which was fantastic, but my wife's shrimp poboy was equally as amazing.  We finished it off with hot blackberry cobbler that was freshly prepared and served with cold vanilla ice cream.  I left uncomfortably full, but every bite was worth it.

Give this place a shot.  You'll have a new favorite.

Cajun food is supposed to be flavorful and spicy right? Well not at Cajun Yard Dog. We tried the étouffée and jambalaya and Neither has much taste to it. Very dumbed down. They are also quite skimpy on the seafood. Service was slow for lunch because it seemed like only one waitress ran the restaurant.

Sean, Brayden and I had a great experience on Sat. for Sean's bday dinner. The small place is in a strip mall, decorated very cute with a Mardi Gras theme, the wait wasn't too bad, but we came early, 6:15pm. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She has been there for 14 years! We had the chicken seafood jambalaya with fried okra, fried chicken, smothered cabbage, fried shrimp, and mac n cheese. There wasn't anything that wasn't awesome!!
