The dog sauce was flavorful and not too spicy. It was great on the fried chicken, but the chicken was so good by itself. Even the blueberry and blackberry cobbler with ice cream was delicious. The chocolate Pecan pie was not as moist as we thought it could be, but it was still delicious. We also bought a tshirt as a souvenir.

Have nothing bad to say... 

The BBQ Shrimp and Grits(Appetizer size) is really enough for one person. I can't imagine what the entree size looks like. Perhaps that's best for 2 people. This dish is similar to the one at Cajun Queen. Its not spicy but the flavor is still on point. The grits were creamy and there was just enough sauce for some bread if needed. Would have liked some more sauce but it's all good. 

The Fried Green Tomatoes are a bit under seasoned. Throw a bit of salt in those bad boys and we're in business. My Homie likened this dish to eggplant Parmesan with some crunch.

The service was top notch. Our waitress was very attentive even checking on us when we were done with our dishes and she collected them. I think the manager or owner (?) came over to make sure everything was okay with our meals. Stellar service... Smiles, patience, attentiveness... These are a few of my favorite things when it comes to service. 

I'll have to come back with the dude to try some of their other tasty dishes.

The shrimp and grits was some of the best I have had! The service was really slow , I sat at the bar on my 1 hr lunch break and got over looked for several min and they were not even busy..but once I did get serviced it was great and I would definitely give them another try!

I went by the CYD to grab some gumbo to go. Wouldn't you know it, I locked my keys and wallet in my car! While waiting for the locksmith, the owner graciously gave me my gumbo and asked if he could offer me anything else. Totally amazing service, food and a very hands on owner! and if you need a locksmith, call Neil Williams 704-307-8536 at Consolidated Locksmiths. He opened my Mercedes after other professionals said it could not be done without the car "locking up".

Appetizer: Jalapeño pimento cheese
Entree: Fried Catfish
Result: Delicious and unique.
Need somewhere for a fun, unusual night out? Cajun Yard Dog is worth a try. So much better than the same old chain. Staff has always been friendly and attentive. Basically what I'm trying to day is, you could do a lot worse for southern fare.

I ate here the other day and it was amazing!!! We were welcomed as soon as we walked in the door and was seated. The hostess took our drink order immediately and brought over a drink menu when I asked about what specialty drinks they have. All of them were very reasonable priced ($9 or below). I ended up getting the Mardis Rita which was excellent. We ordered the Gumbo as a starter which could also be considered a side for the entrees. The gumbo was so good and some of the best I have had in the Charlotte area. For the entrees we ordered the Fried catfish and shrimp and crawfish etouffee. Both were amazing!! The only issue is the menu did not state you got catfish bites for the entree so it was assumed it would be a filet but it was still so delicious there was no reason to complain.

I will definitely become a regular here even if I just come in for a bowl of Gumbo. Can't wait to return!!

Last night was our first visit to this Fort Mill based restaurant. I say Fort Mill based because there is the Charlotte location. It was busy but no wait time for a seat when we arrived at 6:30pm. We had really good wait staff. Quay was attentive but not over-bearing. Our meals were very good. My husband and I decided to have gumbo which really was a hearty bowl of soup with mussels on the side as well as shrimp (large and small), chunks of chicken and was delish. We thought it would be a cup of soup so by time we consumed every drop we were full. Our meals were great as we did the pick 2 choices. We both had fried jumbo shrimp and I had crab cake while my husband had catfish. All was good. My husband wasn't a fan of the cole slaw. Wish we had room in our tummies for desert so Quay suggested we start with desert next time :) That's what I'm talking about ... good looking out. We do like to venture to other restaurants for different dining experiences & not because our failure to return is based on bad experience. 

The only critique would be to develop a good cocktail menu with established options. We ordered created cocktails but found them to be OK and as such the 4 stars. 

The team at this restaurant worked well together in providing good service. Location is very close to our home so revisiting in the future is a definite. Maybe 5 stars if the cocktails are on point and the food is consistent. Something to look out for with next visit....

Wanted to visit this place for a long time. Had the crawfish etoufee with a side of mac n cheese. It was awesome!  Sat at the bar and the lady who waited on me was incredibly attentive and charming. They pride themselves on their selection of hot sauces, but the best on offer is the the one that they make. If you like a little extra spice, ask for the "dog sauce".  It's incredible!  Nice people, fast service, great food and friendly employees. It is a great strip mall find.
We had the BBQ Shrimp for an appetizer. They were very good and flavorful. The grits were 2 thumbs up. The tobasco strips were homemade and had a great flavor. The Mac and cheese was exceptional.

If I could I would give these place 3,5 stars but unfortunately I can't so 3 stars will do.
They have a nice decoration that reminds of New Orleans. My husband was raised in New Orleans and he mentioned this place so many times that finally we went check it out.
We were sat right away and our waitress was very sweet. 
Their menu has many options, however it is pretty pricey for the kind of food they serve.
Considering that the place was very busy the food didn't take too long to be served.
The food came and I was kind of disappointed with the amount that was served. We ordered a combo with 3 options (fried shrimp, fried fish and crab cake) we also had two sides, fried okra and cheesy. The food was just okay, nothing to brag about. They also charge fo
With that being said the probability of us going back is very small.

I absolutely LOVE Cajun Yard Dog! My first time going was a few years ago when I use to live in Charlotte. My boss took me and we liked it so much, we went back with our entire team. So since I was recently in town for CIAA, I met with a former employee there. The food was great - we had the jalapeño devil eggs as an appetizer (perfection), both of us has the crab cakes (delicious - seasoned to perfection...I wish it was bigger tho), and I had a side salad and sweet potato fries. My friend had mac & cheese & cucumber salad. The mac & cheese was so good, we ordered an additional side of it & shared it. The service was okay, but in the waiters defense it was his second or third day. But I have confidence he'll be great going forward. He was kinda cute too . Another great experience and the food was great too. I will definitely be returning again.
What a wonderful meal! I had the Shrimp & Grits with collard....YUMMMM....hubby had catfish....yumm again!  Be sure to sit in Quay's section......she 'da bomb!

This was our first time visiting the restaurant. We were very please in our selections and was greeted with a welcoming style. The decor is definitely NOLA and my husband and I thought is made us both feel like we were in New Orleans. The food portions are huge and the beer selection was decent. Would definitely come here again.

The MOST amazing find!! Who knew New Orleans was hiding in the Arboretum!! This place is great! The owner Allen has done an amazing job with keeping the food 100% creole and creating a genuinely southern ambiance!! The Etouffe is rich and flavorful, and a good portion. The Collards made my lips smack...if your a soul food officianado you know that means good!!! The potato salad and Mac&cheese were excellent! I've found my new Favorite Place!!

Went here for dinner on a Friday night.  The place is small and was very crowded so we had to wait for probably 30 minutes.  I had heard good things about this place but ultimately ended up leaving disappointed.  He ordered the crab cakes and I had the grilled chicken.  The chicken did have good flavor but it really needed to be charbroiled - I'm not sure how it was prepared but I just left wondering if they had boiled the chicken and then coated it with the seasoning.  I only ate half of my plate because it was very unappealing.  My husband's crabcakes were good - crispy on the outside.  The remoulade was also tasty.  Overall, I thought it was overpriced and underwhelming.  Likely will not be returning.

Awesome authentic NOLA food and atmosphere. I travel to that part of the country and this is as good as it gets. Portions are huge, fresh, and fairly priced. Great local and micro beer selection and tasty desserts. Does get pretty busy on weekends so just be prepared to wait... Fast bartenders make that tolerable! One time had fried green tomatoes that were out of season, but that's the only negative in 10 visits.

Currently sitting in Cajun Yard Dog, I just demolished my seafood jambalaya. It was incredible as always. We are up visiting family and there was no question where we were headed to dinner tonight.

Can't wait to come back!

This place is the real deal. The Tabasco strips are unmatched. Excellent beer selection! If you can get in early on a Saturday do yourself a favor and order the chicken and waffles...if they haven't run out yet! I have yet to be disappointed with any dish in this place. My only gripe would be that there isn't a lot of seating, but this kinda adds to the whole atmosphere and gives it a touch of hometown charm. Bravo Folks! Keep doing what you do!

I know from experience that it's a server's worst nightmare to have a table of 25 be seated!  Our service at the CAJUN YARD DOG was impeccable; the servers were friendly, attentive and knowledgeable.  Our drinks and food arrived in a timely fashion and everything was hot and delicious, with generous portions. Again, that's just short of miraculous when you are talking about a group of this size!  We all were impressed and delighted.  Well done, CAJUN YARD DOG!  Thanks for making this celebration a special night to remember.
Delish!!! Eat here when I am at the Arboretum. If you like Cajun food you will love it

Listen, the food here is great. The employees very attentive and nice. My problem is the absolutely ridiculous side charges for something that should be a part of the meal. $10.95 for a lunch of meatloaf I can live with, what is a normal side with meatloaf? Why yes mashed potatoes, well if you want that here it's $2.95 extra so now we are at basically $14.00 for lunch. Get my meal and its a little tiny, tiny bowl of potatoes, ugh, ask if I could have some gravy for the potatoes was told sure but thats $1.00 extra. Are  you kidding me. Absolutely crazy. Will certainly reconsider ever going here again. It's like booking an airline flight where you have to pay extra for everything.

Hubby and I have gone here about half a dozen times .  The last visit was not the best... it appeared they were short staffed in the kitchen, so the wait was pretty long. But -- the food was still great.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 just for that visit.
Other than that -- we have become HUGE fans of this place.  I was a little reluctant to try bc I'm not a huge Cajun fan, but glad we did.  Their specials have always been really good -- especially the pan fried trout with creole andouille and crawfish cream sauce.  They have good selection of fried platter options, including shrimp, oysters, and catfish and their app menu has some great options too.   The owner and staff are all super friendly and very eager to make sure your experience is a great one. We will be back!!

Yuck is all I can say. The service was good but that's where it ended for me. I ordered the hamburger 'Po Boy' style. It was way over cooked (I ordered it medium) and was not juicy whatsoever. The side I ordered was the sweet potato fries. They were overcooked and limp with little flavor. I feel like I totally wasted my money. I won't be back.

This tiny local haunt has been a favorite of mine for years. They're not too many Cajun alternatives South Charlotte. This place is very casual and is typically stuffed at lunch, mostly with loyal regulars. Although not a regular, I do enjoy lunch here every couple of months or so.

I normally choose the mahi, with the mashed potatoes and the collards. Everything is served with their homemade biscuits. The Shrimp Po Boys are also tasty. Service is always reliable and the restaurant consistently reflects pride of ownership.

New location but the same great food. Now CYD has the best Cajun fried chicken in two states

Great location and it's double the size of the CLT location. I hope they open the comedy club next door again and give Fort Mill/Tega Cay a night spot.

Wasn't impressed. They sat us near the back by the men's bathroom and the exit door. Which you could see the staff going out and in taking cigarettes breaks. The smell tells it all. The food isn't Cajun at all...we've been to restaurant that serves real Cajun food and this isn't one of them
The fried chicken is to die for and the Mac and cheese will make you like your plate. I love finding these little gems in my home town!

Yay! Cajun Yard Dog is here! Great service and wow what a great job they did remodeling the location. It really makes a difference for the shopping center.

As for the food, it's just what I expected excellent. Clasic Cajun favorites. Things not to skip out on: 
The salad with honey mustard dressing. The honey mustard dressing is a scratch dressing with garlic and a mild chili pepper that give it an excellent flavor almost like a pepper jelly.

The fried catfish- super light and flakey you cannot miss with this.

The fried chicken on the bone. You will have to wait a bit longer but it is very worth while. The chicken is pressure cooked with a unique light flaky batter.

Red beans and rice. My favorite side has a nice flavor and comes with huge chunks of jambalaya sausage on top.

Chocolate pecan pie. Done right. The pecans are chopped which makes for a naturally sweeter pie and they are plentiful. Best pie around!

Great cajun fried chicken but suuuuch a looooong wait. But all the food is so good here. It's hard for me because I have no patience. I have opentable and I am used to walking in and sitting down, but the food is just so darn good here I give in every time. Hmm. What do I like. Umm. Everything.  But most of all the chicken, the catfish, the fried green tomatoes, the jambalaya. The owner is also omnipresent which shows just how much the place means to her. The desserts are really great too, but you knew that.  I would tell you what time of the day I noticed it was slower, but then it wouldn't be slow at that time anymore now would it? So fend for yourselves!  Just kidding. It seems to be slow around 2pm. When I say a wait I mean 1-2hrs 5-9pm every time I've gone so if you can go at an off time and you have ants in your pants like me do so.

We ordered the deviled eggs, crawfish etouffee, and the chicken jambalaya. 

The deviled eggs were super tasty and had a nice kick from the jalapeno that made for a unique twist on a common dish.

The etouffee was pretty good and had a ton of crawfish but I thought the chicken jambalaya was better.  The macaroni and cheese was out of this world delicious.

Service was friendly and good.  It was definitely a casual restaurant but definitely delicious food.

This cozy lil spot serves up the best New Orleans, Deep South cuisine. My favs are the catfish nuggets- so fresh, crispy and well seasoned, and the smothered cabbage. Yum yum yum . It's not for the fitness faint of heart but super flavorful and satisfying. You can always burn off your calories by walking around the Arboretum!  Staff are friendly and seem to know the regulars. Bar selection good too! Very affordable and healthy portions... Depending on how you look at it lol

Small and intimate joint with limited seating and a modest beer and wine bar. Everything was on point. The Shrimp and Grits were rich and flavorful, with a hint of beer, jalapeño and Cajun spices. They were complemented by wonderful collard greens and smashed potatoes. No problems, but the portions could have been bigger. Since I live right across the street and expectations were pleasantly exceeded, I'll make it a point to come back.

Exceeded our expectations.  I had the seafood Gumbo and the Shrimp and Crawfish etouffe and it was very flavorful and enough spice to actually taste.  Was a little scared about the atmosphere but it was much more  family friendly than I thought.

Our second time to this location.  Menu and food was great, done right with large portions.  One of us had the fried oysters, the other had the  chicken and seafood jambalaya.  Had a slight mixup in one drink order, but they correctly it immediately.  Very pleased with our meals.
Something struck us as strange, though.  As good as the food is, we did not see many customers at all on a beautiful Saturday evening.  Also, we both felt the staff was almost overly attentive (you don't see that these days!), as if they were trying too hard to please for some reason.  Maybe it's a fluke, but it struck us as unusual.
Overall, great meal and service.

Great Service!  Early dinner here last night... Crawfish Etoufee very good (4.5 yelp stars), Collards (4 stars), Sweet Potato Fries (5 stars Fantastic with a little vinegar on top), Anduole Sausage (3.2 stars) and for Dessert: Chocolate Pecan Pie (3.9 stars).

If you like New Orleans cuisine you'll love this place. The etouffee is REALLY authentic and tasted delicious. We started with the jalapeño deviled eggs - great flavor. They have a good beer and wine selection. The food was a bit slow to come out but the service was very attentive without being overbearing. We will definitely be back!!

Loved this place. Will definitely be back when in the Charlotte area. Fried oyster appetizer was fresh and lightly breaded. I had the wahoo (catch of the day) sandwich and it was very good. My husband had the fried chicken which was awesome and a lot of food (it does take extra time to prepare so it's fresh). Great menu wig good options for seafood, Cajun, southern.
Awesome fries green tomatoes and shrimp and grits! The appetizers make a great lunch!

Really bad experience at the Cajun yard dog.  Salad was warm, soda flat and my meal was room temperature.  I will never go back there again.  After we decided this was not worth it, we went to the Cajun Queen orderd the exact same meal and it was 100 times better.  The service at the yard dog wasn't much better.

Thumbs way up: a variety of Abita to choose from, including root beer for the kiddies.
Thumbs kinda downish: gumbo that smells and tastes like pepper gravy and BBQ shrimp that don't seem BBQ'd at all. More like stirred up in some tomatoes in a pan.
Thumbs really really down: zydeco mardi gras hell atmosphere
I know you are never gonna get real Cajun, Louisiana cooking in the Carolinas or elsewhere, but why? Why is it that even people FROM Louisiana can't open a place in another city and have it be authentic? It's like there is an Authenticity Force Field around south Louisiana. 
I am giving this place 3 stars because of the Abita and the fabulous appetizer called the Calamari Okrachokie (fried okra, calamari and artichokes with a sort of Cane's sauce, if you know what I mean) and the perfectly breaded and fried catfish filet. It's harder than you think to fry stuff in a truly appetizing way. And the very friendly and accommodating staff gets my appreciation as well.

TL;DR version: Food is definitely lacking, but not inedible. Fried catfish appetizer was best. Sauces and Dressings were decent. Blackened fish was inexcusably dry and overcooked.  Banana Foster was good, although the ice cream was noticeably old even after being drenched in cognac sauce. Ambiance was lively and enjoyable. Server (Marc) was knowledgeable, timely, and friendly.  Host (possible owner?) was a total dick.


This was our first ever visit to the CYD.  It was around 7:45 on a Saturday night. We added our name to the legal pad by the door and I asked to see a menu as the host was leading a party to their table. "Absolutely" he said, as his eyes pointed towards the floor. No smile. A few minutes later he returned and crossed our name off the list, and asked if we were ready to sit. 

"Actually, We'd like to see a menu before we make a decision." I said. We immediately decided the menu would be acceptable (for the teens, that's why we asked).  Another group of four entered the restaurant. The host sat them ahead of us, then had the audacity to tell me they were there before us. It wasn't a huge deal, as the next  table had just become available, which he explained.  He led us to the still dirty table, and as he was wiping he told us that we could just let him know when the 4th member of our party arrived and he would bring a 4th chair.  I wasn't down with that plan. He wanted us to sit down, but then when our 4th member (who was still in the car) walked in, you want me to get up from my seat, chase you down to ask you for a 4th chair while she just stands there? Don't think so, buddy. So I grabbed an empty chair from the table beside us and pulled it up to our table. "I have chairs over on that side." he tells me. Good. Good for you. Go get it yourself. WTAF?

 Our server was prompt and polite. We enjoyed the beer selection...from the list that the host failed to provide us with. (Can you tell this dude rubbed me the wrong way? Letting it go now ;) We ordered the fried catfish app which was piping hot. There were five pieces. That fifth piece was highly coveted. I had a side salad, which was reasonably fresh. It was a spring mix with shredded carrots, tomato wedges, and sliced cucumbers. No complaints there.

Entrees: Blackened salmon w/horseradish sauce. Sauce and seasoning were satisfying. Salmon was dreadfully overcooked. Regular & Sweet potato fries were both acceptable. Mahi--same issue. Tooo dry. I had the special, which was blackened tuna over dirty rice with a crawfish basil sauce. Tuna was (can you guess? I bet you can guess.) waay overdone! The rice? Tasted like it came right out of a stainless steel 1/9 pan. Definitely not fresh. It wasn't even warm.  I liked the crawfish, though. You might be asking why we did not alert our server to our distaste, especially before writing a less than stellar internet review. That's a fair question, and as shitty as I have made it sound, we ate ALL of our food. 6 hours in the hot sun at a Rugby tournament, and you too would eat whatever was set before you in its entirety. The food wasn't THAT bad, but it was unequivocally unimpressive. Except the Banana Foster. That gets a solid thumbs up. Yum!

Another shout out to our server, Marc, who never let our drinks run dry, spaced our courses perfectly, and answered all of our questions. He cleared and reset the table between each course.  Great job, Marc!

New ownership at this place,  however the food is as good as my prior visits.  On my previous  review I gave it four stars because the place was starting to look run down and dirty  and the health score had dropped as well. That's not the case anymore. It looks cleaner and the health score has gone up too.  Will definitely be coming back.
The food is always amazing and the service is too! Little hole in the wall spot with a fun authentic feel inside too. Love it

This was my first time here. Friends have highly recommended it and others advised me to pass. I decided on carry-out. 

I had the chicken cordon bleu (blue?), potato salad and mac n cheese. I also ordered some jambalaya. The chicken itself was very good. It was crispy, moist and nicely seasoned. Essentially a great fried chicken breast with a slice of ham on top followed by cheese and maque choux. Chicken, slice of ham, corn, cheese and spices. Although good, not exceptional. The mac n cheese was good. The potato salad was average. The jambalaya was good, but not exceptional for a Cajun restaurant. Maybe I was expecting more? I would go back, but not necessarily out of my way.
Food is well seasoned and you won't go home hungry. Overall a good experience. I will be back.

This place is awesome we had the chicken jambalaya perfect, gumbo perfect,fried oysters,Mac and cheese also yummy and the deserts were bread pudding and bananas foster super delicious our server Jennifer was funny and great. We definitely will be back

I have the pick 3 with catfish and double oysters. And it came with two sides. Which didn't come out until 10 mins after the fish and oysters?.?. The fish tasted like the freezer, the sweet potato fries were old and the Caesar salad was not a Caesar salad. It had blue cheese and cooked red peppers which is not normal. And when I let my waitress know that I didn't like the salad. She did nothing. I will never come back.
Deb was awesome and such a great atmosphere to be at. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a New Orleans experience

I have a love hate relationship with this place.  My belly likes it but my abs hide from it.  If you love savory or salty food this is the place for you.  I happen to love savory but some of the dishes here were a bit too salty for me, like the catfish. And the collard greens.  The fried chicken is well seasoned and tasty but very tangy so if you are not into vinegar marinades this fried chicken is not for you.  I like it.  The fried okra is delicious and salty... Maybe a little too salty but I think we all new what we were getting into going in.  I mostly do take out here because it's very close to home and the service isn't phenomenal.  The servers always seem overworked or like they have another pressing matter to attend to that just doesn't happen to be the diners.  What I love most about this place is for about 30-35 bucks I can get a quality bucket of 16 pieces of chicken and two sides and for a busy mom with a party of 5 and boys who play lots of week night sports, this saves me time and sanity which I'm sure some of you can appreciate.

This place is outstanding. I don't know why I haven't been here before. It's a lot smaller than I thought and can fill up fast. Started with the calamari, totally different then I have ever had before. It come with fried okra and artichoke. I then had the mix platter with fried oysters, fresh and cooked perfectly, and fried shrimp, cook perfect, and BBQ shrimp. Never had BBQ shrimp before so I don't have anything to compare it to but I will be ordering it again but as a full dinner. And if your not real hungry the BBQ appetizer is big enough to be a meal and it's served with grits. Well worth the Arboretum traffic.
The service was great and the food came out quickly. He food was great. I will definitely be back. The fried shrimp and oysters were perfect, battered just right!!!!

I became a big fan of Red Oak (beer) because they have it on tap here.  I'm not a huge beer fan but I would definitely recommend it!  I LOVE their shrimp po boys and I recently tried the gumbo.  Big portions and great prices.  Also, I am down with the buffet of hot sauces!  they don't make things too spicey...so if the thought of hot Cajun cuisine scares you (because you are a baby kitty...) no worries.  This is a great spot!

This our second time here and we have enjoyed it! Apps-crabcake -excellent and calamari/artichokes/okra - very good (some of the best okra we have had)The shrimp and grits was very good! The Jambalaya was ok. The meatloaf was good and the swordfish was very good and cooked very well. The bananas foster is awesome (more ice cream, please)! The wait staff is friendly and efficient.

This is what Tega Cay needed! Good Cajun food in a casual atmosphere. It's a much needed improvement to the previous Madison's on the corner, a neighborhood bar with mediocre food. 

The bar area stayed along with the tv's so you can still watch a game and grab a draft craft beer. I appreciate that they are currently carrying Windy Hill cider.

It was my birthday. We were seated quickly. Our waitress was friendly,  but seemed to be rushed. So there was no "Have you eaten here before?" conversation or let me suggest a few items. And throughout the evening several different servers stopped by to check in on us. We went with a shrimp and grits appetizer to start. It was good. The grits had a good flavor, but I tasted a slight bitterness that tasted like parmesan cheese which didn't quite fit the dish. But the shrimp were cooked perfectly and paired well with the grits. My husband ended up ordering a larger portion as his dinner. 

For my main course, I had the shrimp and chicken etouffe with a side of gumbo. The portion was huge. The etouffe was spicy and full of flavor, just how I like it. I'd definitely come back for this dish. The gumbo was okay.  It was pretty thick and didn't seem as flavorful as the other dishes. I'd probably opt for the seafood gumbo next time instead. I also wish some bread was served with the meal. I like to sop up every bit of sauce.

So, we finally got to dessert and asked if they did anything for birthdays. The waitress wasn't sure but later came out with a piece of cake and said "Happy birthday." The cake tasted like a lemon pound cake and it was divine. It was heated up and just melted in my mouth. It was moist and sweet, but not too sweet. 

There's still a lot of things on the menu I want to try and I'm happy this is right down the road from me.

With my visit to the city my friend recommended this place. I've only had one previous experience with Creole/Lousiana style food and it was painfully (pun intended) so. I was hoping that this new experience would turn me towards the light of Creole/Cajun food. Meh, not so much.
 
We ordered a app, essentially fried okra, calamari and artitchoke and on the menu it said it was to be served with a remoulade. First, I do have to admit everything was fried nicely- even the calamari. Typically most resturants cannot fry calamari correctly to save their asses. Cajun Yard Dog (CYD) did this well. The amusing thing that happened when our waitress dropped off our app is the 3 of us instantly noticed that dipping sauce was no remoulade by anymeans. It looked more like ketchup and mayo mixxed together because it was not throughly combined before placed in the ramekin. I was already hesitant to taste it just because of the unappealing appearance of this sauce. After we all tasted it, we concluded it tasted like cocktail sauce with mayo mixxed in. I did not use the dipping sauce after that and simply ate the app on its own.
 
I ordered the crawfish etouffee. When I ordered it I was really walking into it blind. I knew I wanted to try something different and I've actually heard of a etouffee. But I figured crawfish, rice in a sauce, it really cannot be too bad. I got my etouffee with a side of collards. My friends got a meat gumbo and a blackened chicken po'boy.
 
First appearance of my plate I was taken aback. There was a very hearty helping of crawfish indeed. But the sauce was a very dark brown murky looking color with bright red crawfish atop and small scoop (albeit) white rice underneath it with a small saucer of collards placed next to it. Appearance is not everything in food, I've learned that. Jumping headfirst into tasting it because I was eager to see what this etouffee was supposed to taste like, I took a large bite. First taste impression? I thought it tasted like sort of a muddy river. It reminded me of watered down dirt. It did not taste like much else so I covered it in the hot sauce they had sitting on the table hoping I'd like it more. I did. About 20 so splashes of hot sauce it was more appealing to me. My collards were a disappointment. I love collards. A school friend from back home prided himself on cooking 'soul' food well, and he does. His collards I can still remember the flavor and texture. Just soft enough where the leaves would melt, but the stems need to be slightly chewed and a delicious bacon-veggie flavor. I got none of that from my CYD collards. I thought the collards could have been cooked a little bit longer and it needed more overall flavor.
 
I had a small taste of my friends gumbo, she did not say much. So I guess it was not much to talk about. The blackened chicken po' boy was a very hearty size. I did not ask about the taste, but he seemed fine with his sandwich.
 
Though CYD has not turned me off from Cajun/Creole cusine I am still saddened I cannot find or understand what this love of spicy, heavily season cajun/creole food when all the food I've tasted has not been spicy and or even that flavorful to me.

So glad I FINALLY found this place.
The food was great and the waitress was just as awesome.
We will definitely be going back soon

Food was great! Had the grouper blackened. Also enjoyed the craft beer selection. Unfortunately there was only one server for the whole restaurant and service could've been quicker. Still recommend this place none the less.

Went here with co-workers on a Friday. Definitely a place that deserves repeat business. 

I ordered fried oysters and red beans and rice - and I got some of the best fried oysters I've had in a long time. I've notoriously had trouble finding any place in Charlotte that had fried oysters that I liked. (Only notorious because I complain about it loudly.)

One of my co-workers got a fish sandwich that looked to die for. One got a BLT which I'm sure was just great....

I can't remember what the rest of the table got, because I was too busy shoving oysters in my mouth and going "yum".

Just ok....  service was slow and we arrived around 4:45pm on a Thursday.  Cucumber salads was not fresh and lacked flavor.  My guests liked the catfish po'boy and jambalaya.  Fried oysters were ok.  Definitely not New Orleans grade, but ok.

Was a little unexcited to try the new Cajun Yard Dog, but since it is close to home, we decided see what it is all about.  We are SO glad we did.  Have been there 4 times and not once have we been disappointed.  Portions are very generous, food is cooked to perfection and their specials are out of this word delicious!  Not knowing anything about Cajun Yard Dog, we anticipated a step above fast food and we were so shocked to find a pleasant atmosphere, great service and fabulous food.  Has become a regular stop for us.

How awesome to have really good, authentic, fresh Louisiana cuisine so close to home! We've been here several times since February and are never disappointed. We've had the jambalaya, etouffee, gumbo, salmon, trout, collards, okra and look forward to sampling everything else, New favorite place for spicy, flavorful Cajun food, c'mon!

Really good!  We tried this place last weekend and the food was great.  Catfish, deviled eggs, potato salad - all awesome.  My friend had the pasta dish with shrimp and sausage and it was seriously good.  Very good service too.  We'll be back!

As the name would imply this is a Cajun restaurant in Fort Mill, SC. All of the food that I have had from them has been good except for one time when a new cook was in training. They have a different special every day and they serve the lunch menu until 4 PM. They have a full bar with a decent draft beer selection. I have always received good service at this restaurant. It's the same great food as the Arboretum location without the crowd!

Weve made 2 trips.....grand opening day, good service, good food, a bit pricey...we had catfish app, etoufee, and tabasco strip sandwich with cabbage....only thing to note is that tabasco chicken, had no spice at all....2nd trip on Thursday, i had meatloaf po boy, while good, very little to no spice to it....supposed to have a sauce, but none detected...she had blt po boy and cabbage (yes, she loves the cabbage!)..blt was very good....2 issues on this visit ( none with food)..when we arrived, only several filled tables, we asked for booth, host said they save them for larger parties???, they seat 4.... we were sat at a 4 place table!....to add to that, after denying us a booth, we pointed to a table, he said, no, we will seat you "here".....we said, ok, wow......2nd issue wife noticed while going to restroom, with open view to kitchen, noticed floor was very dirty....she said, "filled with food".... we will give another shot, but will wait a while to hope they "get the bugs out"

This used to be one of our favorite restaurants,  but it has taken a downhill turn the last few times we have been here.   Tonight,  the chicken cordon bleu arrived with no cheese.   The maux choux sauce had no corn,  no peppers, or anything in it.   Just a dull cream sauce. I don't know if there are new owners,  etc., but definitely no where near the quality and taste. I'm sad.

Cajun Yard Dog is amazing! We finally tried this place for date night. I love the feel and vibes of the dining area but I do not love having to sign my name on the wait list. We only had to wait a couple minutes and a bus boy (?) seated us at the only open table. After being seated everything was wonderful. The service was attentive and all the food was delicious. I ordered the salmon with veggies and potato salad. Everything was perfectly cooked and the portions were huge. Hubby ordered jambalaya with Mac and cheese and his food was amazing as well. I can't wait to come back!

Smothered cabbage. 

I almost want to end this review with those two words. Smothered freakin' cabbage. 

If you haven't had the smothered cabbage, you are missing the true meaning of life. I can't even properly describe it, as the description won't do it justice. No matter how many times I wash my hands, my fingers are not clean enough to type of the holy deliciousness that is Cajun Yard Dog smothered cabbage. It's something like cheese sauce that the cabbage is in...I'm not sure what that stuff is, really, but it's GOOD.

There's all kinds of wonderful cajun specialties, and the menu also has a few Southern classics, like the pimento cheese plate. I enjoy the pickled vegetable salad as well. Their prices are reasonable, the service is good, and the decor is as charming as anywhere I've been in Charlotte.

Yum. Just Yum. Came here because it was so convenient to shopping and was so surprised by how delicious our lunch was. Had Shrimp and Grits with Collards and my daughter had Red Beans and rice. We will definitely be back. And we didn't get dessert but the bread pudding that was served to the ladies at the next table was beautiful and they raved about it.  We all wanted more as soon as we finished!
The staff was great and owners were really nice. I love Cajun food, however my food was a bit too greasy for my liking.

So happy to have a yummy Cajun restaurant close by in Tega Cay! I coordinate a monthly lunch group which numbers between 20 and 30 people and we love checking out local restaurants. Cajun yard dog wasn't known to many of my group but we were made to feel at home right away and the service was spot on. Lisa took care of our section and she had all sorts of good recommendations and advice that made our dining experience even better! I had the crawfish étouffée with a side of green beans almandine and both were delicious. My mom had shrimp and grits and I had a bite (since I can because I'm her daughter) which was very good. The sweet potato fries were a little tired. I went around the table and checked with everyone and they were all happy with their orders and felt it was good value for the amount of food that we got. Besides the great service, what also impressed me was that the manager/owner came over a number of times and made sure that all was wonderful. I'm looking forward to going back and trying out other tempting Entrees. Also the desserts looked awesome! If I wasn't so full I would've split one with my mom, but then I would've had to waddle back to my car and that isn't pretty. All in all we had a wonderful lunch and I would highly recommend Cajun yard dog for delicious Cajun food!

I should try this place more often. The first and second times were pretty good experiences for me. Sometimes they're busy so it takes a few minutes before a server starts things out for you. The food is great, the interior is fancy and decorated with lots of Mardi Gras things. The sign is very bright neon yellow which is easy to find. The green beans a bit weird though, I wouldn't try those again. They mix it with something else which takes away the taste of the green beans. 
The inside is a bit small though, limiting the seating if it's crowded.

Delicious!!!

Appetizer #1: jalapeño deviled eggs.....very good!!!!

Appetizer #2: seafood gumbo...freaking delicious!!!!

Dinner for the wife: shrimp and grits with side of fried okra....she loved it!!!!

Dinner for me: crawfish creole with side of collards...the bomb dot com!!!!!

Dessert:  double chocolate pound cake...wow!!!!

Service by Bridget was excellent and the owner, Al was very nice.

I haven't been here in a long time and I've been taking about it to my wife for a while and we decided to go when we were in the area. Not only did I grow up in Charlotte, but I grew up in New Orleans too. So, I would call myself a Cajun food expert. 

There aren't that many places in or around Charlotte that have Louisiana/New Orleans level Cajun food and I always considered CYD to be one of them. However, on this trip, I just wasn't impressed. Years ago, I would swear this was the best place in town, but not so much now. Not to mention the prices are a little on the high side. With the food competition cranking up, you have to have really great food to charge high prices. 

It's always sad to see a restaurant you use to call the best not live up to its expectations, but it wasn't terrible either. The service was great, the atmosphere was great, it's just the food was decent and the prices were too high. 

I'll save my next Cajun food craving for when I'm in New Orleans.

Celebrating my son's forthcoming 14th bday.   His choice was this place largely for the fried oysters and Cajun  did not  disappoint.   Two orders of fried oysters and fried shrimp.   My wife loved the shrimp bc the breading is so light. Service was great too.
Absolutely amazing! Had never heard of this place, and a friend took us out for lunch. Great environment and service. Ordered the chicken and seafood jambalaya, it was delicious!

I had the gumbo and the blackened mahi. The gumbo was delicious. It was spicy and had a lot of stuff in it. I would've gotten a bigger bowl if I had known it was that good. The Mahi was huge! I couldn't believe it was only $15. It was a really good value and included two sides. I got the smash potatoes which was good and the rice which was meh and a bit on the salty side.

I found this place on Yelp and it definitely did not disappoint. I don't think I'll be back in Charlotte anytime soon but this place would definitely be worth coming back.

The kitchen is very dirty and the food is over priced. Being a past worker I would not suggest anyone waste their money eating here. It's recipe based Cajun food that misses the mark and the authenticity. Blahhhhh

If you like Cajun food you'll love the spicy salty food they have there

The staff was attentive,  the menu prices moderate and the food choices plentiful for a small restaurant decorated with a variety of  New Orleans and Cajun glitz

We ordered the beer battered mushrooms which were  very delicious and not greasy with a tasty horseradish sauce on the side

 I ordered the blackened salmon with two sides. My sides were  a cucumber salad, fresh sliced
 cucumbers in a vinegar, hot sauce marinade with red onions which I  personally did not care for 

The smothered cabbage with cheese was my other side,  good but the cheese made it to salty in my opinion.

 The salmon was tender and delicious with the same sauce  the mushrooms came with.

 My hubby's creole chicken was hot and spicy which he enjoyed.  His one side he chose was sautéed vegetables, a tender squash medley which to my surprise was very bland so I traded sides.!

Soup on the menu  but not served in the summer
The restaurant offered a nice variety of sweet desserts and beverages. There is always a catch of the day, market price.

I'd go back again to try something else

We always have a great meal here. The husband and I went for dinner on date night. Everything we ordered was fantastic, not to mention the great service. The servers always remember us and we don't even go that frequently.  This time, the owner who has an eerie resemblance to Mark Margolis...great actor...oops, I digress. :-)  anyway, the owner was awesome and gracious. Awesome experience, as always.

I love cajun/N.O. styled food so once I heard about this place I had to stop in. When you walk in, there is a sign up sheet to be seated instead of a hostess which is a little odd. They weren't busy so we found a table immediately and were greeted. They have a good variety of items on the menu which is great. I went with the Jambalaya and smothered cabbage. The Jambalaya was great and tasted really fresh and homemade. I'd definitely go back for this. The smothered cabbage was different, but ok. It was like cabbage with a cheese sauce over it. The prices are a tad expensive, but they do give you quite a bit of food. The server was talkative and friendly. Apparently they also have some really good pound cake according the the table next to us. I'll be going back to get my cajun fix!

If it would let me give a 3.5, I would. CYD is a story of almosts, yes, plural. My friend and I were trying to escape the downpour. We saw this place across the parking lot and decided to make a run for it. I'll try to keep it short. 

The menu got me stupid excited. It was like I was three years old and stumbled into a candy shop, only full of Cajun food. Every dish sounded great. It was a list full of classics. We got there after three, so we missed the chicken and waffles! Dammit! 

I decided on the Catfish po'boy so I could eat half and save room for the chocolate pecan pie later. My friend ordered the blackened meatloaf with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  My po'boy was okay. I've had better, but it wasn't bad. My friend's meatloaf and sides were very good. Though, there was nothing blackened about that meatloaf. A bit of a misnomer, but awesome nonetheless. 

Dessert fell flat. My chocolate pecan pie tasted more like a melted hot fudge sundae. I wish the chocolate had more body to it, like a custard. My friend's bread pudding was also just okay. 

I plan on returning, but next time I'll try an entree instead of a po'boy. OH, no liquor here. They only serve beer, wine, and nonalcoholic drinks. It's too bad. I wanted a hurricane. The whole experience had a lot of potential. It was almost great.

I am a huge fan of Cajun Yard Dog. Used to travel long distance to their Charlotte location. Great to have one of their restaurants in Fort Mill. Ate there tonight! 

I recommend the Deviled Eggs to start (jalapeños in the mix for extra flavor). For the entre, get the golden-fried catfish with jalapeño tarter sauce. See a pattern here? Level it out with potato salad and mac and cheese. Boom! For dessert, get the chocolate pecan pie and a coffee. Done. 

Cajun Yard Dog y'all!!!

Cajun Yard Dog is a great restaurant. I had the fried catfish. It comes with jalapeño tartar sauce and two sides (of which there are many). I chose the mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. For dessert, have the bananas foster. Awesome!

Don't be discouraged by a line. Small place, delicious food, worth the wait!

Calamari Okrachokie is a MUST. Fried okra, calamari, artichoke... with a delicious dipping sauce. We almost ordered a second!

You can't go wrong with their daily specials-I had the fried trout that came over the crawfish etouffee, and a side of collards. My boyfriend ordered Seafood Jambalaya with macaroni and cheese. Everything was excellent-and the mac and cheese is a must order!

They also have an awesome beer selection! I can't wait to go back and have their shrimp and grits!

Had a great pre Thanksgiving dinner here.  The service was personable and the ambiance was welcoming.  Had the fried green tomatoes for an appetizer, and all the enteees were great. I had the excellent chicken jambalaya, and my kids had the crab cakes and Cajun chicken.  Both were fantastic , especially the crab cakes - and we are from Maryland so praising NC crab cakes is saying something!  Can't wait to come back, but I highly recommend for anyone in the area!!  Great for a pre- or post -movie night bite to eat!

A very solid 4/5 stars. With any restaurant I always ask myself Would I go back? Sure. 

Good food Delicious food.
Lovely red beans and rice and you do get the feeling that you would like to see someone earn their beads
The best EVER! Myself and my entire staff eat here at least 3 times a week. The catfish, salmon, Mac n cHz, smothered cabbage EVERYTHING is amazing and friendly customer oriented staff

How could this place get a 4...it's so awesome! 5 stars all the way. This is a quaint hidden gem with delicious authentic Cajun cuisine. I usually go to Cajun Queen because of the convenience and they also offer I standing Groupon deal but this is definitely the better of the two.

I have been here multiple times and it never disappoints. It is very small and you generally have to wait if you come here on a weekend for dinner but it is so worth the wait. 

Though their specialty is Cajun food it definitely has a soul food flair. I could honestly just come here and just eat sides. They have the best cabbage I've ever had in my life and their Fried Chicken is to die for.

Tonight I opted for the special because it looked way too good to pass up and it came with two sides. It was a blackened sea bass top with blackened shrimp and a sea crab sauce. Whatever you're thinking it tasted 10 times better.

If I had to find one fault it would be that they do not have a full bar however they do have beer and wine and they have some great local beer from New Orleans. Get the Dixie Voodoo. Trust me you won't be disappointed!

My ultimate spot for Cajun food.  I always tell coworkers, friends, and family about this place.  My favorite meal is the Seafood and Chicken Jambalaya with mac n cheese as one of the sides and mash potatoes.  I recommend that for any first timer.  I've eaten here on my birthday at lunch time.  It's usually always packed in the evenings.  My new favorite is the fried chicken.  The chocolate pecan pie is divine!  I didn't care much for the blackberry cobbler nor the smothered cabbage (not my taste).  The food is usually consistently good but had times recently where I got the catfish for the first time but no sauce was in my bag for it, bland almondine string beans, and bland mash potatoes in that particular order.  Other than that I still like this place a lot.

Tucked away in the Arboretum Shopping Center is a little piece of Bourbon Street, dressed with mardi gras masks, Christmas lights, and beads.  Somehow they managed to keep it classy, with intimate seating arrangements and quiet music.  Think New Orleans jazz hangout rather than Girls Gone Wild.  

I love their great beer selection with a big variety of IPAs, lagers, and stouts.  I have never once eaten craw fish in my life, and I decided to brave it out and order the Black and Blue Craw fish Pasta, the special of the night.  It was a portion large enough for two meals and it was scrumptious.  I thought the blue cheese complimented the crawfish (and I was a little scared of this combination at first).  

Taylor, our waiter, spoke with us about the restaurant and his love of Cajun food.  I felt very welcomed and I am a craw fish fan now as well.

Blech!!!! Cajun, seafood blech!
The fish was so cooked that it fell apart with all the bones. Couldn't even get a bite w/o the bones.

This is a very hard review for me, but hopefully ... My explanation will help you understand the low rating. I ordered the blackened salmon with two sides of the smashed potatoes and the cucumber salad. Everything was very tasty. But the piece of salmon that I received was seriously 1 inch wide by 6 inches long. For $10! Now I'm not sure why, but every time I go, it seems like the salmon serving gets smaller and smaller. Not sure if it's because it's lunch? But I'm a big girl and I like a normal piece of fish. 3-4 inches wide by 6 inches long. Very odd experience for me. I wish I had taken a photo, but it was just so surprised that I just dug in and ate what was there.

This is a good new restaurant in Tega Cay, SC. 
I had the fried catfish and my wife had the fried chicken dinner. The fish was very well cooked and the breading was crispy with a nice hint of heat. The chicken was very crispy, moist and flavorful. 
Our server was very friendly and professional. 
We will definitely be going there again soon!

Let me preface by saying that I am a New Orleans born and raised native living in the Carolinas.  That being said, were this restaurant in Louisiana they'd be tarred and feathered and run out of town.  My husband and I started our meal with the chicken and andouille sausage gumbo. It was good. It did not taste like any gumbo I've eaten before, but it wasn't a bad soup if I forgot that they consider it gumbo.  My husband ordered the shrimp po-boy and I ordered the red beans and rice with andouille sausage. His shrimp were undercooked, definitely under seasoned and drowning in mayonnaise.  Water has more taste than these shrimp.  Red beans and rice from Louisiana is often considered creamy.  Red beans are cooked with ham and sausage until they fall apart and they have a creamy consistency and a pink color.  These beans needed several more hours of cooking.  The sausage in the beans tasted boiled.  The beans themselves were spicy and that is the nicest thing I could say about them.  To be honest, if you want decent red beans and rice outside of Louisiana go to Popeyes, at least they are creamy with some flavor.

Great food and very flavorful. Also the drinks are top notch and that's something your not going to expect from a little place in the corner of a strip mall. Decor is kind of ok but let's face it if you want affordable top quality Cajun food this is the place to go.

I was very dissatisfied with the place and I had heard such great things about it my service was terrible I'm not sure if she was having a bad day or what but she was very inattentive I disliked the food as well everything I ordered was bland only thing good to me was the chocolate pecan pie

So solid and crispy reliable.

I have no idea if this is authentic Cajun food and I really don't give a shit.

All that matters is, this is tasty eats.  Check it out if you are in the mood for some fried semi-greasy goodness.

I love the food here. I don't know how authentic to Cajun the food is - never had true Cajun - but I've never not enjoyed my meal. The remoulade is delicious as well - perfect heat. My only complaint is that their wait times are outrageous. They need to offer reservations or move to a bigger building with more staff. No one wants to wait an hour with no other option but to just wait for their name to be called. Worth the wait, though, if you ask me.
Fantastic menu and preparation. Great beer and wine selection. Friendly and extremely knowledgeable staff. Very neat story.
The food was A-Mazing!  One of the best Southern meals I've had.  The fried chicken and blackberry cobbler were to die for.

I was very interested in visiting CYD (Cajun Yard Dog) simply because Madison's was gone and they're new. Which is great for this area! I ordered the deviled crab cake and Okrachokie minus the okra... (I am an okra snob and frozen just doesn't cut the cake, but that's just me). What was left was artichokes and calamari. I also LOVE red beans and rice. This version contained andouille sausage. 

How was it? The calamari was fried with the artichokes and that's where it goes wrong. Calamari cook extremely fast, so fast in fact that the breading is often under cooked while the calamari over cook. They come out a bit rubbery and the artichokes were soggy. The breading was a bit bland. Which was a bit of a shock.

When I was looking the menu over I was rather intimated by all the Cajun and jalapeño ingredients, but I shouldn't have been. The heat is warm and builds, but stays rather mellow. Sauce is king here, delish! 

Next up is the red beans and rice. I got here at 7:45-8pm and they close at 9. I am saying this because it is rather late to be ordering food. The rice was perfect. The seasoning was spot-on! Really good flavor here. However, the sausage tasted like it had been cooking for about 24 hrs, way over cooked and a bit grainy textured. The beans were good, maybe a bit dry, but again, the flavor was as really great! 

Lastly, the crab cake. I saved this for last because it was my favorite! I am a Floridian originally and this deviled crab cake took me back to my home state. They are thick (possibly a bit too thick) but taste just like the thinly battered deviled crab I grew up with. Don't expect it to be a Maryland crab cake... this is purely the Southern deviled crab cake. 

I'll will be returning to tray actual dinners and at a better time. 

Update! I returned to CYD this evening and got the red beans and rice again, the crab cake again, and this time a kids shrimp with Mac and cheese. All the items were cooked to perfection! The crab cake was superb for a Cajun crab cake (which is served deviled crab style, I love it!) I also ordered fried pickles, which are new to the menu and they are probably the BEST fried pickles I've had in a long while! They are dill and crunchy! I say this because pickles are wet and that usually makes the batter coating a bit soggy, not the case! These are crunchy dill and the breading stays crunchy also! The sauce has just enough kick for you to know it's spicy, but I was still able to keep dipping.

I am happily updating my three stars to 4! Can't wait to try more of the seafood!! Enjoy!

It was good and cooked to order, but not cheep. 
Kids meals $6.00 plus side and drink; but no milk!
Blacken salmon with two side- dressing good sweet fries not so good. 
Shrimp po boy- good job with it
mac and cheese- good
Kids loved their fried shrimp

This place rocks! It's right by my house so we just went there after church. I got the jambalaya and my husband got the meatloaf po boy. Both of us took home leftovers because the portions were so huge! Food was authentic and tasty!

The food was wonderful! We had the Seafood Jambalaya and the Crawfish Ettouffe with the fried oysters as a starter. Oysters were a little small, but flavorful. Both the jambalaya and ettouffe were delicious! Only one thing that would prevent us from revisiting is the awful long wait. We waited about over an hour! The place is very small, so be sure not to show up hungry on a weekend night! :)

I have been only twice, and have gotten only the fried chicken and the fried catfish (woe to my arteries). Both have been among my favorite meals in recent memory. The fried chicken was juicy and well seasoned. The catfish was expertly prepared and was almost melt-in-your-mouth. Okras were delicious. Mac and cheese was among the best I've had. Slaw was unique. I recommend this place with no reservations.

Great 1st time experience.  The staff was friendly, the food was great, and the environment was nice.  There's something on the menu for everyone and a few televisions are available for the sports fans.

Always love the catfish bites!!! Sometimes that's all we order for the table. Service is not always that friendly and they have turned our group away in the past, but we'll keep going back for the catfish.
Found this hole in the wall. Everything we ate was delicious. Mac n cheese is top 3 best I've ever had. Definitely will be returning! Keep it up.
Went for lunch had the fish it was to strong like it was old. The owner was rude he made our group feel very uncomfortable. Won't be back

Had lunch here with my husband and I must say the best food in Charlotte hands down. We're Caribbean so we tend to look for flavor without adding anything extra. My husband ordered shrimp & grits and the red snapper. I ordered the catfish with masked potatoes and it reminded me of grandmothers cooking. I ordered a slice of key lime pound cake and fell in love. All of my childhood memories in one spot.

The key to this place is ordering right! Highly recommend their fried chicken or chicken jambalaya. Friendly staff and owner keep us coming back. This is a must to try if you are in the south Charlotte area. 

But keep in mind seating inside and the outside waiting area is limited and its first come first serve.

Had a date night here.  I had chicken etoufee and wife had blackened salmon and gumbo.   Both dishes were tastefully presented and tasted good.
I give it a 3 star b/c it was a little pricey for the atmosphere.  Also the etoufee did not appear to have REAL Rox sauce.   What I got looked like tan gravy versus the real dark, rich Rox sauce I love.
Lastly there was no Dixie land jazz music which I like to hear when I'm at a Cajun restaurant.  Take a couple pointers from the Cajun Queen in charlotte and y'all be alright.

The Yard Dog has style, their own style, that is. It's campy and fun to go there. I like their menu (my husband is crazy about their cajun meat loaf) and they have a calamari appetizer that is amazing. 

I highly recommend their fish entrees if you like fish (steamed or fried or, of course, cajun!) Not particularly impressed with their red beans and rice, but their etouffee and gumbo are excellent. I love their side dishes, which includes mac n cheese, fried okra, cucumber salad, green beans and much more. 

The Yard Dog always has fun beer options and a great dessert menu, as well as an easy kids menu that will please the picky little eaters in your family.

Great little hole in the wall place. the seating area is small in this strip mall. but the flavors are huge. For lunch we wanted some Cajun flare. Immediately upon walking in you think its a little cheesy decorated place, but then we seated ourselves and was soon greeted by Lynn who says she was going on her 9th year there. she was so joyous and helpful with lots of information. She made our daughter feel great buy teaching her how to make a star in the bead necklace, (Lynn---Shelby thanks you!) 
After reading reviews here we decided to order the deviled eggs, although they were tasty- I think my own have bolder flavors. BUT the fried green tomatoes was outta this world!! WOOT WOOT we had the fried chicken which was recommended by Lynn and it was really good, I could taste that they are either soaked in Texas Pete or it is at least part of the breading process. but detected no "heat" per say. The chicken was crispy outside and very juicy inside. The mac n cheese is nice as well as the cucumber salad. 
Great place to get some fried foods that are made to order and in house!!! no pre processed crap here!

The fried oyster is my go to when I stop by. Heck, it's the only reason I drive over to the area. I've ordered the dish since 2012 or so. Recently, it seems like they've changed the recipe for it. They used to be full sized oysters that was coated nicely in batter. Now, it's bite sized pieces and when I ordered my take out, it was overcooked. If I had the time, I would've requested them to remake it but today, I had to eat what was given. 

They have other food items which aren't that bad. It's the only nearby creole that I know of. The decor has that Mardi Gras feeling. Very causal but it's a small seating area. If you plan on a large group, it's best to call in before stepping in. 

Sometimes it's busy but at times when it's not, you would expect the servers to check on you every so to make sure you're good on the beverages. 

It's a nice little restaurant and if you're in the mood for the type of food and are nearby, then definitely stop by.

The hostess station is weird. I wouldn't even call it a station. It's a legal pad and your write your name and party number. 

I ordered the shrimp and andouille pasta. It was creamy and amazing. Our waiter was friendly and hospitable. I have a long list of dishes that I'd like to try. 

They receive pound cakes on Tuesday from a local bakery and the cakes are usually sold out by Friday. I've heard great things about the pound cake & can't wait to try it.

I love this place!  I eat here several times a month and it has always been good.  The seafood gumbo, crab cakes, crawfish etouffee, cajun meatloaf, catfish and sides are great!  I have probably ate here 50 times at least.  Everything is fresh made and the service is fantastic.

Very good food, good wait service, but we got a horrible table that completely killed the experience. We watched the host and owner debate how best to divvy up 3 tables for a 6 top and 2 top. Ultimately, we as the 2 top got the shaft and were placed right next to the door and those waiting for a table. They were less than a foot away, and the host and owner manager kept walking up to our table, and talking to the people behind us. Terrible experience, although if we were at any other table, we would have had a great time. That one table sabotaged the entire experience for us and I can't see going back.

Wow it was really great, the oyster app was only $10 and had at least 12 oysters, perfect to share.  Blackened salmon was amazing, loved the grits and stir fried veggies, and husband got etoufee and it was filled with crawfish.  So thrilled that for once we were able to have a relaxing meal in a restaurant where we weren't rushed.  She took our order after our appetizer arrived, which was great.  Perfect service-you could definitely see the owner's influence and attention.  Which is rare these days.

Tonight we stopped by Cajun Yard Dog for dinner and it was outstanding. We split the fried calamari as an appetizer, which was absolutely delicious - I loved the creamy cocktail sauce, and it also had some fried okra and even a couple of pieces of fried artichokes in the mix. 

For our entrees, I ordered the fried oysters with a crab cake, and a side of mac and cheese and grits. All outstanding! The crab cake was especially good with a spicy sauce on top and a crispy outside. 

My husband ordered fried shrimp, blackened Mahi Mahi and a crab cake with a side of sweet fries and Mac and cheese. The Mahi Mahi was delicious and I highly recommend that combined with the crab cakes for the perfect combo. 

Service was really good as well. We will definitely be going back! We would have taken pictures of the food but we ate it all too fast!

We LOVE the Cajun Yard Dog!!   My Gumbo cravings keep me coming back!  My 12-year-old loves the Tobasco Strips with Mac and Cheese.  He also has to check out the desert menu which has fresh surprises every week.  He enjoyed the sweet potato spice caramel pound cake this week.  On a scale of 1 to 10 he gave it 100!  I feel the same about the Bananas Foster!

This place is a true hole in the wall but an amazing find! It's super small and you'll def have to wait for a table but that's about the only complaint. I had the shrimp and grits and it was amazing! The grits were perfectly cooked and not overly cheesy, the shrimp were good size and flavorful it had just the right amount of spice. I had the Mac and cheese as my side, its home made creamy and delicious. My boyfriend had the fried catfish which was the best I've ever had. It was super crispy, the breading stayed on and not greasy at all. The only subpar thing was the chips appetizer we ordered, they weren't hot and probably been fried a while ago and the dipping sauces were pretty bland. Over all it's authentic cajun/creole and worth a try, you won't be disappointed.

This is my favorite place to go to satisfy my taste buds. The food is absolutely delicious! And the owner ensures that the service is top notch! I can't recommend just one thing because everything is good!

I love this place!! The fried chicken is amazing. The macaroni and cheese is fantastic! Shrimp and grits are great. 

So far I haven't had anything I didn't like! 

Here's a tip: try the dog sauce!!!!

The staff is very friendly. This place has a very comfortable feeling. New Orleans style restaurant. If you haven't been you need to go!

Creole cooking - the largest mystique of my culinary curiosity. Sure, I've eaten a lot of weird shit; it's a trait that comes with shoving an item in your mouth as your first method of solving general curiosity. But Cajun food... how does it work? What the hell is in it that is supposed to make it so good?
My general impression of Cajun food is that people, living in a swamp their whole lives, lived off dredging the bottom of river beds and boiling or frying whatever came up. Usually when people are faced with the most unusual ingredients, then they'll work their hardest to make it taste good, and there came the allure. Creole became my culinary unicorn. 
Living in New England, I didn't stand a chance at finding any creole. I read up on it a lot, but also couldn't find a lot of the ingredients, like a gumbo file or crawfish. 
When I moved to Charlotte, I had my first Cajun experience at the Cajun Queen. I split a seafood etouffee. While not holding the spice I was hoping for, it was pretty good all the same. 

Thusly.... we come to the Cajun Yard Dog. It was an interesting night to go. I had loaded up on margaritas and wasn't feeling all that hungry for the fried oyster po'boy I had been eyeing on the interweb for months, so instead went for the gumbo. 

I got the wrong damn gumbo. I wanted seafood gumbo, because chicken, sausage and rice doesn't interest me, and it was in a beef broth, not seafood stock, so it wasn't particularly to my liking. For what it was, though, it was pretty good. I was expecting something much thicker, however. There was a spicy tang at the end, but not much of a flavorful palate to begin with.

We did start off with the fried artichoke/okra/calamari app, and that was pretty good, but standard fare. Their 'remoulade,' as a lot of people have pointed out, really tastes like mayonnaise and cocktail sauce slightly stirred together. Not impressed. 

One person I was with got the crawfish etouffee, but it wasn't as flavorful as the one at the Cajun Queen, not to mention that there was too much rice and it overwhelmed the sauce. Also, the collards were undercooked. 

The last item that didn't disappoint, was that my friend got a blackened chicken po'boy. This was a frickin' huge sandwich, and the chicken was cooked well, was spicy, and had huge slices of tomato with lots of lettuce on flavorful bread. The one thing that I really wanted turned out to be the only really good thing at the table. 

Bottom line: 

The atmosphere was friendly, and the service was good.
For food, stick with the po'boys. I am definitely going back because I need a fried oyster po'boy! Everything else that I experienced... I'd want to go elsewhere.

I am so excited about the awesome new restaurant! Finally something new and different in the general area. 

First - they have made changes since it was Maddie's. New paint, lots of decorations making it a fun space to hang out in. I had been trying to dray my fiancé here since it opened. Apparently he thought it was some form of hot dog place. What? No, definitely Cajun food without a hot dog to be seen on the menu.

We went late one Saturday for dinner and it was only moderately crowded. Our waitress was friendly and prompt with all of our orders. We started with the jalapeno deviled eggs which were just okay. Far too much salt for me to love them. I ordered the crawfish etoufée because I like crawfish but hate dealing with the shell. Etoufée is one of my only options to enjoy crawfish. I upgraded my side to gumbo and had it come out first because why wait any longer than you have to for gumbo? The gumbo was a full delicious bowl with just the right amount of spice. My etoufée was also yummy and came out on a huge plate. Even without a side or app it was definitely a two meal amount of food. 


The real winner of the night was my fiancé's delicious chicken and seafood jambalaya. It had all sorts of seafood in addition to chicken and sausage. It also came with a touch of heat and the restaurant provides three different hot sauces to kick it up a notch if you want. 

While the weather definitely called for some spicy rice based dishes on this visit I was also excited to see lots of blackened fish and other lighter options. I love places that offer a variety of choice. It looks like they also rotate fish based specials as well!

I heard very good reviews on this place but was not thrilled.  First, the service was poor.  I don't know if there weren't enough servers, but it took a while to be served.  I had the Cordon Bleu, which I love, so was hoping the reviews were correct.  I ordered a beer as well.  Not the best selection but manageable.  Anyway, as soon I saw the ham and cheese on top of the chicken, I was skeptical.  Yup, not the way to prepare this dish.  It was a little dry.  It wasn't horrible but I was expecting a lot more. The mashed potatoes were just okay as well.  The waiter never asked if I wanted another beer and my wife had to hunt another staff member down to get water.  I may try it again if friends wanted to go, otherwise, I don't think so.
Not the best Cajun food I've had, but still very good. Owner seems to take pride in creating a great restaurant. Great addition to a Fort Mill area that's greatly lacking food diversity.

After taking over the previous dive of a sports bar, I was curious to see what the folks associated with CYD had to offer Fort Mill. The interior looks slightly different after they took some time to re-do it. I wouldn't consider it to be a sports bar anymore, more of a family restaurant. Even though they still have the flat screens from the previous bar, they are not open late like a sports bar.

They definitely disappoint on the food side of things. The waitress talked us into the catfish "bites" as an appetizer, as you can see in the photo - "bites' is not an adequate description! You could definitely consider these a meal by themselves! They were tasty indeed.

I ordered the meatloaf with side of collards and red beans/rice. The meatloaf was very good! So huge I forced myself to stop eating half way or I would need to be rolled out to my truck! Jeez. My friend is a po-boy connoisseur and he came back with two deep fried thumbs up after chowing down on the shrimp pro-boy.

They do not offer draft beer, but they have a very small list of bottled beer including some Louisiana favorites. They bar can also assist in select liquor drinks. (Editor's Note: Unless you;re craving a vodka/red bull, they do not stock red bull.)

Simple. Cajun. Goodness. I would return.

I had heard good things about the 'dog, and have to say that in general, I was a bit disappointed.

We happened to be in the area for one reason or another, and so we stopped in for what we hoped would be a quick meal. The menu looked appetizing, and after placing our order, we settled into a nice discussion and waited for things to arrive. And waited. And waited. And waited.

Eventually the dishes showed up, which meant we were able to dig into our dishes, and it just led to some disappointment. To be fair, it could have been because of the huge wait. But the dishes really didn't live up to the description on the menu, or to the level we  had been hoping for that was seen by many other reviews. They weren't bad - they just didn't have the kick we were expecting.

Off night? Perhaps - it happens to everyone. We may try again, but since they aren't in our neck of the woods, it might be a while.

On the upside, the decor was definitely interesting, and because of the service misses, we had plenty of time to look at it.

Had lunch on a Tuesday with friends; we arrived just before noon and had no trouble getting a table; but, the tables filled quickly, and became quite loud. Our server was nice and checked in on us through out the meal. I had the Fried Crab Cake with the House made Macaroni and Cheese: both were tasty. It was an enjoyable experience and I will be back again.

I went to CYD for the first time last night with a friend. As I am a vegetarian, this may have not been my first choice, but I'm always up for trying new places and my rating is a balance of my experience. Five stars for the fried okra and chocolate pecan pie, 2 stars for the deviled eggs  and 1 star for the iceberg tomato salad. I wanted the Cesar salad, but they were out of romaine lettuce. The place is small and we waited at least 40 minutes for a table, but there's a lot of shops in the strip mall to pass the time. Our server was courteous and efficient. If I go back, I'll get the fried okra again and try a few more sides.
Grossssssss! Walked in and immediately smelled like someone was smoking in my face. The bartender said "it's probably the owner" ummmm Ok that makes it even worse. Left immediately.

Don't know how people are saying the food was bland, we thought it was awesome! Tons of flavor, everything made from scratch in house. Awesome shrimp and grits and crab cakes! All sides were delicious. Service was also fantastic. Came out very fast. I'm just visiting but my family will definitely be back.

We were looking for a restaurant close to my friends house and found Cajun. I asked the waiter about the most popular Po-boy and he suggested the shrimp. So I ordered the shrimp Po-boy with the smash potatoes and a side of the pickled beets. My friend had the fried shrimp, collards and fried okras. The Po-boy was larger than I expected and was delicious with just the right amount of shrimp, tomatoes and lettuce. The pickled beets was one of the best I have had from a restaurant, and plenty of them.
My friend had the shrimp and they were large jumbo shrimp that wasn't heavily dipped in batter. The were light and flakey. She said the collards were good. I didn't taste them because they were  cooked in pork. A good night and a good choice of restaurants. 
The only bad thing was waiting for a table and waiting for our food. I'm glad we didn't order an appetizer because we took home another serving of food.

Great menu. Blackened mahi mahi very good. Smothered cabbage really good. Price is a little high for lunch (around $11  for entree and 2 sides) 
Good bottled beer menu, around 8 beers on tap. Great service and personal attention from the manager. Definitely a nice addition to the area

Have been going to the Yard Dog for years and am surprised it is just now receiving attention on Yelp! The food is fantastic with daily specials. You can't go wrong ordering as I have never been disappointed by any of their offerings. The staff is just as authentic as their food and the decor adds to the experience. Looking forward to the next visit!

Spent over $100 on a Togo order for company after getting a recommendation from a girl I met shopping. Well 75% went in the trash. We had entrees and apps. Nothing was appealing. Maybe we should have dined in.
