This is one of the few Charlotte restaurants my husband and I visit on a regular basis and is one of the few restaurants we take visitors to Charlotte to.  Although small inside, the atmosphere is jumping with everything "southern" and "Louisiana" on the walls.  The waitstaff is very friendly and have great recommendations for first timers. The jalapeno deviled eggs are an excellent starter. For lunch I always get the Catfish Po Boy with sweet potato fries.  For dinner the red beans and rice entree is my favorite.  Be sure to save room for Chocolate Pecan Pie or take it to go. Good beer and wine selection too.
Wow. Exceeded my expectations. Loved the hand cut french fries. Cajun food was authentic. Great for kids too.

Great place in Tega Cay with authentic Cajun food. I had blackened Mahi, collard greens and pickled beets and my nephew had the jambalaya and fried okra. All of it was fantastic!  Met the owner, Al, who guarantees the best meal or your money back.

Food is always good! Small place so allow yourself enough time to enjoy your meal. They close at 10 and are usually busy. You will be waiting for an average of about 20mins to be seated. Don't keep this friendly staff at work longer than they have to be.

Food was fantastic.  Service was good.  Wait for table was bearable.  Bar selection was okay.  We liked the small atmosphere with eclectic decor.  We will be back.

What we ate:  
Calamari Okrachokie - delicious artichoke and okra, pretty good calamari.  
Shrimp & Grits - Over-the-Top Delicious.  Makes my mouth water to type.
Blackened Mahi with pickled beets and green beans - very good fish, really liked the beets, green beans were good but nothing too special.
BBQ Shrimp with Jambalaya and sweet potato fries - BBQ shrimp and jambalaya were great, SP fries just okay.
Bread pudding - huge portion of incredible dessert - melt in your mouth delicious.

I guess coming from NY, I have high expectations when it comes to flavor and cajun food. Sadly, I didn't think this was as good as it is hyped up to be. The southern charm is real though.. employees and waitstaff are super friendly but the food itself has been made to please the pallet of the southern people. Do not expect true, authentic or spicy, deep ingredient cajun food here.

This place is as close to True Cajun Cooking as I have experienced since I left Louisiana!  I had the Chicken Jambalaya with Mac n Cheese on my first visit and it left me with definate desire to return.  The Jambalaya is exactly the way I had it Down in LA.  Who DAT?  The Cajun Yard Dog is Dat!  The texture and the Flavors were right on mark.  It was an explosion of different flavors going off on my taste buds!  Not just a meal, an eating experience!  After all isn't that what we all want when we go out to eat.  Well you will find it here.  The Mac n Cheese is to die for.  It is very similar to my wifes Mac n Cheese and I absolutely love her Mac n Cheese.  Creamy, Rich and the pasta cooked just right, tender buit not soft and mushy.  Delicious!
My wife had the Fried Catfish with Jalapeno tartar, fried Okra and Red Beans and rice!  I sampled each of her items and this is my opinion of them.  The Catfish was nothing short of amazing!  Very Crispy on the outside and light and fluffy inside with a hint of spice(heat) in the batter. Mouthwatering by itself but the Jalapeno Tartar made it pop!  The fried okra was just like Mama made it!  Delicious!  The Red Beans and Rice were so good It'd make you want to slap your Mama!  A perfect blend of seasonings and spice to drive your taste buds wild!  The best Red Beans and Rice I have ever had and I have had plenty.
I asked the waitress how the Gumbo was and she quickly brought me a sample.  It was just like I had expected.  Right on the money!  All thier dishes are made fresh daily and have the flavor and feel of a homecooked meal.  The atmosphere is upbeat and vibrant with that small romantic New Orleans Cafe feeling!  Awesome for a lunch date or any occasion.  To sum things up, I had an outstanding meal with a decent price in a comfortable environment.  What else could you want.  My family and I will definately be back!  WHO DAT?  WE DAT!

While on the wait list I had to use the restroom.  Thankfully I got to experience how little they care about cleanliness at this place.  The men's one person restroom had a lock on it that didn't work, a stall that you couldn't close and lock, urine and paper towels littering the toilet seat and floor, and a sink that after use would make you feel more dirty than when you started.  After returning from the restroom we walked right over to Panera Bread.  Too bad as I was looking forward to trying this place for the Cajun food, but I probably saved my wife and I from an evening of stomach pains!  After a few episodes of food poisoning over the years I've learned that if a restaurant cares that little about the customer experience (that they refuse to even fix their restroom) how could anyone believe they care about your experience with their food/drink.

Tried to get lunch and after ten minutes of no attention in regards to menu order etc. I walked out while the place was at 40% capacity at best. No idea how the food is but the service seems to be horrible. No one seemed to care.
Bon temps.  Very good substitute for being in New Orleans.  Debbie was a doll and took good care of us.  Save room for bananas foster and bread pudding.  Hello food coma.

This place was good; the calamari and okra appetizer was great, excellent meatloaf, the BBQ Shrimp were good, and the pecan pie was GREAT!
I don't know how authentically cajun this place is, but they serve comfort food, and I left comforted!  
This is a great place to split an appetizer, main dish, and dessert between two people...plenty of food.  Good value!

Delicious food all the way around, I got the Tabasco po boy and my daughter got the meatloaf po boy. Both were really tastey and I even had half of hers for lunch the next day. I was originally drawn here for their bananas foster dessert, it seems like the only place around that serves it and they definitely delivered. We will definitely be returning!
One of my favorite spots in all of Charlotte. Friend okra, calamari, blackened salmon, po boys, all of it. Everything is great and staff is ALWAYS friendly.
We've eaten here a number of times for lunch & have always enjoyed our meals. The shrimp & grits are excellent, as is the shrimp po' boy.

First time here. Chose this because of yelp reviews.  The cajun Chicken breast was the best!  And the smothered cabbage was to die for! Greens were way to  salty for my liking. Fried green tomatoes were yummy!!  The jalapeño tarter sauce was not working.... but great customer service and i will definitely be back!

The food was okay, but it took almost an hour to get our food after we ordered it.  When the food was finally brought to us, we still had to wait for a side that was being "made to order."  Really, it takes over an hour to boil some noodles and make a watery cheese sauce for mac and cheese in a small side dish bowl?  The unsweetened tea had gone bad and I had to send it back.  My friend was brought the wrong beverage and then argued with when she said it wasn't what she ordered.  The owner was nice and apologized about our wait when we told him our problems, but we were only offered a free dessert after being told about their small kitchen and a large to-go order that had come in slowing down the restaurant.  At that point, we just wanted to leave.  

This was my first experience at this restaurant.  I had heard good things, but good things wasn't my experience.  I hope they were just having an off day.Not sure I'd go back.

Once again a great experience. Food was fantastic and service was spot on. Sunday 4pm, no one there so we sat at the bar. The blackened swordfish special was great. It came covered with pineapple slaw and a wasabi honey mustard sauce. Cooked perfectly and a good size portion. The red beans and rice were better than I expected. The catfish fingers and Mac n cheese are seem to be consistently good. We were sold on bananas foster, it did not disappoint.. We will return!

One of my favorite places - I've been frequenting this place for as long as I can remember. I usually go to the Arboretum location but am excited there's a new location in Fort Mill (eventually I'll get there). My parents are Yankees that moved to LSU for college and they said it's at close as you can get in CLT. I've been to NOLA three times myself and agree. I usually get the crawfish etoufee, seafood gumbo or fried oysters. When they have blackened trout on special I get that. Their green bean almondine are the best green beans I've ever had. If you're feeling extra fat kid get the chocolate pecan pie. Servers are great and I love that it's the same crew since I started going here which usually is a good sign in how they treat their staff.

My husband and I have been here a few times and have yet to have a bad experience! The staff is friendly and attentive but aren't intrusive or bothersome.  Prices and portions are reasonable.  The food is delicious!  I am not a spicey food person so Cajun food is generally out of the question for me, but I have to say I really like this place! On our most recent trip I got the chicken cordon bleu with a side of mashed potatoes -- highly recommend!  My husband has tried the gumbo and etouffee and loved both.  Give the Cajun yard dog a try you won't be disappointed!

Small place in Arboretum out-door mall. Great food! Reasonable to lower prices. Some unique low-country/Cajun dishes. Live music on Fri. and Sat. evening. Get there early the band has their own following!

The food here is delicious, the service spectacular, BUT do not order the blackened salmon during lunch if you are looking to receive more than a 3oz filet. I don't think I have ever been to a restaurant that serves 3oz as an entrée... I could type about this for the entire review but I will move along :-D

Lunch items ordered:
Jalapeno deviled eggs: just regular deviled eggs with pickled jalapenos in the middle of the plate
Blackened Salmon - cooked perfectly but very small, seasoned just right.
Almond green beans- yummy, but a little to overcooked
Collards-DELICIOUS, I will just order two servings of this next time lol
HOUSE SAUCE- I put this on the deviled eggs and they definitely made them better, worthy of the "not your mama's deviled eggs" title after the addition of the sauce.


I will most likely visit the original location In Charlotte, NC . Maybe the dinner size salmon will be at least 5oz. ?

We have been here several times since moving to Charlotte.  Not being a Southern boy myself, I can't attest to the authenticity of the recipes, but the food is just straight up good.  My wife always goes with the shrimp and grits, while I might go with a blackened fish of the day or the fried chicken.  And don't forget the rice and beans as a side.

On the very enthusiastic reviews of Rebekah, Joy, and others, we headed to the Cajun Yard Dog last night and it was as good as advertised.

The staff was one of the best and most friendly in Charlotte.  The gumbo and jambalaya was very good and, as Joy so fervently reported, the smothered cabbage was excellent.

We finished it off with a fresh buttermilk pie which was absolutely delicious.  

Great staff, delicious food, cozy ambiance and Abita on draft.  What else could you ask for?

Crap I'm so full I can hardly write this review. My stomach is way beyond my pants. I really tried to stop but the bread pudding came out and it was a beacon of  deliciousness and shamefully I did inhale. Prices are 10-20 per plate. Bread pudding was just under 6$ not including 1.50 for ice cream. Fried shrimp not over cooked amazing. My son said the Mac and cheese was the best. Service was good. It's smaller inside then I thought. Def worth a try. I really wanted more crawdad on the menu but oh well it was still good and we will be back
Food is delicious. Really love the Jambalaya. Owner is super cool too. He came by and spoke with us several times. Very personable!

Very laid back child friendly atmosphere! Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. The food was satisfying but I cannot give this place 5 stars because nothing was extraordinary about it.

Definitely worth going to for lunch!

I heard a few months back that Tega Cay was getting a "Cajun Yard Dog". I have never been to the Arboretum location, but I have heard great things. That, plus being a fan of Louisiana food, convinced me to give it a try... and loved it! I ordered the Crawfish etoufee and the Mrs got their special cob salad. We both really enjoyed the food. Cool restaurant inside. Now the place just opened up, so the typical "kinks" will be ironed out, but I am convinced this place will be around for many years!

Let me start by saying the servers here are wonderful. Friendly, attentive, caring, and quick. Now I will start with the appetizer...catfish bites. Ok...the flavor was good, but second bite into them I pull out a hair in the batter. Absolutely disgusting.  The server quickly took it away and was very nice. I didn't order another. The second course took forever to come out. It was a busy Saturday night, but I still think here should be some type of order or limit to how long customers should wait for food.  I ordered the blackened tuna, smothered cabbage, and cucumber salad. The tuna was good, nice taste.  The smothered cabbage was delicious, I was happy with that.  I would not get the cucumber salad again...it wasn't bad, just not what I had thought. The blackberry cobbler was very cinnamony and lacked blackberries. The manager took the catfish bites off the check, but didn't come out to apologize or offer anything to make up for the hair or the wait.  All in all, I'd rather spend that kind of money somewhere else.

I read good things about Cajun Yard Dog so we decided to try it last night. Our server was great and the food was delicious. The tabasco strips were very tasty. We are glad Tega Cay is getting some better restaurants.

Omg. Soooooo good. A lot of fried /fatty food so if you eat healthy this is a good "cheat day" spot. I never had fried catfish and it was so good I am open to try it again. Their specialty yard dog sauce was sweet and spicy- definitely one of a kind. Collard greens didn't have much flavor but I was okay with that as everything else I got was so flavorful . My boyfriend got steak with bbq shrimp and the shrimp was good (I don't eat red meat) as well as the steak per his words. He was in love with the sweet potato fries and homemade honey mustard , I swear he inhaled them. I will say for the price it isn't a lot of portion. No left overs as everything seemed to come measured in 1 cup servings. Other than the price vs. quantity of food everything was great!!!!

This place was packed on Saturday night, so I was really expecting to have my socks knocked off, especially considering the reviews on here. The place is small, so expect a wait if you go during peak times. The food was ok, but not spectacular.  Waitstaff was nice and friendly.  I had the fried flounder special over fried green tomatoes with a bleu cheese slaw.  The fish was ok, but under seasoned, and the fried batter just fell right off and was a bit soggy and not as crispy as I would expect.  The fried green tomatoes were the best thing on my plate, they were very good.  The slaw was alright, but not very strongly seasoned or flavorful.  We had some gumbo, which was ok, but again underseasoned, and had lots of rice and not much meat or veggies.  Someone else ordered the blackened trout, which was ok, but still, underseasoned.  Blackened should be very spicy, but it wasn't at all.  The mac and cheese was ok, but with that runny cheese sauce like out of a box, not stringy like there was actual melted cheese in it.  Collards were ok, nothing to brag about.  The best thing we had was the Jambalaya, which was still skimpy on meat and mostly just rice.  It was seasoned very well though and had a little bit of heat.  Overall it was an OK meal, but I've had a lot better.  When I end up dousing everything in hot sauce its clearly not a great meal.

It took us a long time to get down to this place, but I am so glad we did. The food was delicious, I can't wait to come back again.

We ventured down to south Charlotte, and found ourselves there right before the dinner rush (and yes, there was quite the rush/wait after we got in). We started with the calamari that had artichokes and okra. There was a lot more okra than I wanted, but the calamari was light, crispy and delicious. Then I ordered the shrimp etoufee for dinner with a side of beets. The etoufee was just the right amount of subtle spice, but extremely flavorful and I wanted to lick my plate clean. The beets were delicious, some of the best I've had out in Charlotte, and I wanted more of them! My husband had the fried chicken, and he was raving about the crispy skin but moist chicken inside. He nicely shared a bite with me and I couldn't agree more, it was delicious!

Cajun yard dog is definitely a place we will frequent again and again!

The food was so good.  The catfish bites were amazing...melt in your mouth amazing!  The gumbo was delicious.  The fried shrimp and bbq shrimp entrees were excellent, but I definitely would order the fried shrimp next time.  And the best item was a side item...smothered cabbage, OMG!  I've never had cabbage like this before, smothered with Swiss cheese.  I also tried the Mac & Cheese which was great, but I would try another side next time. Lastly, you must try the banana bread pudding with vanilla ice cream to top your meal off!
Smothered cabbage was delicious. Very friendly staff and comfort feel inside. The jalapeño deviled eggs and fried oysters or calamari or anything else are mandatory
Love this place.  Best etouffee in Charlotte.  Great fried chicken.  Great sides.  Their smothered cabbage is like nothing you have tasted.

Been dying for fried chicken and tried this place on the suggestion of a friend. Ok, the way some of these people described this place made me think I was gonna walk into some kind of shithole. This place is adorable!! Small and cozy. Very Mardi gras themed, but not over the top. We went around 6:15 on Saturday and were seated right away. Waitress really nice, knowledgable, and attentive. We ordered the jalapeño deviled eggs and they came with a ton of jalapeños which weren't needs, since the eggs had a nice kick already, but needed more mayo. Obviously premade, but good. We saw other plates coming out and they looked big so we split the half fried chicken and two sides. The wait was a little long, but it's cooked fresh and it was understandable. The chicken was hot and fresh and crispy and good.! Not the best fried chicken I've ever had but very good. Spices were really nice and not over-the-top but delicious. Tasted very homemade. The potato salad was really good had some horseradish in it. I've never had fried okra but they're on the same type of flavor profile as a zucchini and they were pretty good too. Overall,  the chicken was good and I would definitely go back but I definitely want to try another chicken place that might beat this one. I think it might be Price's Chicken Coop as far as I hear.

Wow, what a let down. I've read so many of these great reviews, I had to try this place out. Met my daughter for dinner here tonight. The place is small but comfortable. It was busy although we didn't have to wait. I ordered the chicken & andouille sausage  jambalaya w/ mac & cheese and my daughter got the crab cake po boy w/ sweet potato fries. My daughter's meal looked great and she said it tasted good too. The sweet potato fries were alright. My meal was a different story. The jambalaya was bland and must have been put on the plate too early because it was luke warm when it arrived. The portions were small and overpriced (14 bucks for the jambalaya). The mac & cheese was the saving grace. It was damn good. I will go back again but will have to try some other dishes. The service was very friendly.
Food was amazing!! It was my first time there and I'm so glad that I tried it! I had the fried oysters and jambalaya. I topped it off with the chocolate pecan pie! I'll definitely be back!

Stopped by this place with the fam, told me it was really good which it was. The service was great to us. I ordered the fried shrimp Po-Boy with sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. I enjoyed it. They had a nice bar in there as well, nice place to stop by!

Cajun Yard Dog is a hidden gem, tucked away into a giant strip mall.  My sister insisted on taking me and my family here for lunch (dinner gets crowded and we don't like to wait).  They have a pretty nice beer list that includes Abita, naturally.  I had the shrimp and grits with a side of fried okra.  I make shrimp and grits at home and I'm a pretty good cook, but this was much better than the one I make!  The grits were very creamy and cheesy, and the shrimp were flavorful!  The fried okra was fantastic; the coating was light and not greasy at all.  My sister always gets the chicken and waffles if they have them on special and she said it was fantastic!  My dad had the fried oysters and red beans and rice and his plate was clean at the end of the meal.  
Service was fantastic, Jennifer did a great job of treating us like family and checking up on us as we enjoyed our meal.  If you love cajun/creole food or just want to try it, Cajun Yard Dog is your place!

Good food not amazing Cajun food. If everything was 3-5 bucks cheaper they would have MUCH more business. Nearly every negative review is because of the price. I will pay 18$ for a large Bbq shrimp but I want to taste the garlic, lemon, Cajun spices and taste that it is homemade. I'm not saying that this place doesn't do their Cajun food homemade but it seems to me a lot of the stereotypical "Cajun" food taste a little to generic not like it was made from scratch. Just my opinion check it out and decide for yourself. I'll take my business to Cajun queen im Charlotte where you pay 18$ and lick your plate clean.

It's like be transported many miles to New Orleans, Louisiana. The etoufee and jambalaya were authentic and nicely spiced, the seafood combos were plentiful, and the beer selection was great. Don't let its location in a shopping center steer away
Love this place. Service is always great.  Food is outstanding. Special are always a wonderful surprise. Some portions big enough to share so apps, dinner and desert are doable as shared.

Food was ok.  Very small place, but everyone was nice.  I got the fried shrimp which lacked any seasoning but was perfectly cooked. I also had blackened trout, again lacked seasoning big was perfectly cooked.  My husband had the fried chicken, perfectly cooked lacked seasoning.  All in all not impressed but I did get a descent meal.

Excellent. Came here for lunch a few weeks ago with family. I had the chicken and seafood jumbalaya. Awesome. For dessert we had the sweet potato pound cake--whew! That is like a slice of heaven for a pregnant woman. 

My drs.office  is right across the street and I am dissappointed they will not be open today after my appointment is over. Otherwise I would be eating cake for breakfast.

Absolutely deserving of 5 stars.  Not just because the food was amazing, but also because this place is a little tucked away.(alot of people we talked to in town don't even know this is a sit down restaurant! Criminal!).  That's mostly the fault of whoever decorated the outside.  In desperate need of a change to their facade to attract attention.

Notables:
-beer menu has a lot of unique options.  and 3.50 each one!
-great choice of sides.  our favs were the cheese grits and fried okra.
-all 3 entrees we had were amazing.  cooked really well and used really high quality ingredients.

People, just go, okay?  this place is way better than it looks.

We are happy to see a new restaurant in Fort Mill. We enjoy the Tabasco chicken and chicken cordon blue. The Mac and cheese is yummy, but don't care for their other sides. The owner is always so sweet.

This place has excellent food. Definitely a gem in charlotte. HOWEVER. They must figure out a better way of making people wait. There has always been a wait each time I've gone, so I'm sure the restaurant knows they are popular and people will wait for their food. At the moment they have a sign in list at the front, on a normal legal pad, with no one monitoring it. People write in their own names and a restaurant employee comes over every once in a while to call out a name. There is limited waiting area inside and some space outside. During the winter months it is cold and most are forced to wait outside to hear their name. THey need to introduce something where they can text you when your table is ready, or have a heated area outside for people to wait. There is a nice wine bar in the same complex where we went while we waited  but we're worried we'd miss our name. We came back only to wait at least 30 minutes longer in the freezing cold because there is no heating outside. I love this restaurant, I really do, but please update your waiting area situation to make it more appealing to diners.

I can't stop talking about their grits! 
The atmosphere/decor sets the mood for Cajun, our waitress was attentive, and the food looked and tasted great!
We started with the catfish bites (great breading!), he had the crab cake poboy and I had the shrimp and grits! Delicious!
For dessert, he had the red velvet pound cake and I got the bread pudding...we were both very satisfied with our selections!
The portions are great and the price was fair for the quality and quantity! 
We will be back!!
Amazing! Excellent service & the best fried catfish, shrimp & grits & Cajun food outside LA!! Will come back!
All the food here is amazing but the fried chicken is the best I've had anywhere in the country! Love how the staff treats everyone as family like we all eat together there all the time.

The chicken Cordon Bleu is very good, we went for lunch and the only thing lacking was the lunch portion size of chicken... We just needed more chicken it was great the mashed potatoes were great as well!

We learned that we could order the dinner portion which we would do the next time because the chicken was great!

This place is awesome! Stopped in for a quick lunch while house shopping from out of town. The staff were all super friendly and gave excellent suggestions. The blackened corvina fish was excellent, as were the macaroni and cheese and sweet potato fires (to die for!). Will definitely return!

I've been to Cajun Yard Dog a few times before however this is the first time I actually remembered to take a picture and leave a review haha. So this time around I got blackened meatloaf with tomato gravy and two sides, sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. The meatloaf was amazing and the tomato gravy made it 100 times better, the sweet potato fries are the bomb and the Mac and cheese was pretty good, the flavors are all there it was just a little salty for me. I don't remember what I had last time but I live near ballantyne so this place is a good drive, but it is definitely worth it. Mostly for the prices they have it's probably the best for cajun food. However if you're looking for a little upscale, it's a bit pricy compared to Cajun Yard Dog but, you should try Cajun Queen.

Menu was very intriguing...it was my first time there didn't know what to order and I settle for fried chicken, grits, and greens. my grits s and greens were cold, was not impress...on the other hand the fried chicken was to die for...Delicious! Will definitely g go back to try some of their other menu items.

I wandered into this place for a lunch meeting after discovering that the Katz New York deli is closed on Monday and we did not want the "usual" Quizno's/Subway/etc. I will say that unless you know what you're looking for, there's just no way to tell from the outside what the Cajun Yard Dog serves.

At 1:00 on a weekday, the place was surprisingly busy and we were only able to find two seats at the bar, where there was a large TV tuned into a sports channel. The bartender took our drink order (a sweet tea for me and my friend went with a Red Oak draft) while we reviewed the menu.

I settled on the hamburger Po Boy, which was probably a mistake. Not that it wasn't good, but it was a burger on a baguette with mayo lettuce and tomato. I should have tried something a bit more Cajun, which was my own dang fault. I did get the sweet potato fries as my side and they were absolutely perfect - sweet and salty and plenty of 'em!

My friend asked the bartender for a recommendation and went with that - the meatloaf. He said it was very good with the two sides - mixed vegetables and mac & cheese.

The service was good and I was very pleased with the price too. Good, good food. I could see into the kitchen from the bar and it looked very clean. The only downside is that the place is very small  only  a handful of 2- and 4-top tables plus 4 or 5 seats at the bar.

Would I come here again? Absolutely!

It is not your average-Charlotte menu. Most of the food is fried and it is certainly flavorful, but I wouldn't say spicy or hot. 

It is a decent casual place to grab lunch and I would certainly go back.
Food was ok . Very disappointed with entrees . Just didn't taste that great . Deviled eggs were good . Services was also very good

We went for my wife's birthday.  It is a small, nicely decorated Cajun restaurant in a nice strip mall.  We had to wait a while as it does not take reservations but that didn't matter. The food was spectacular, our waitress, Lynne, was awesome and gave us spot on recommendations for entrees. spices were dead on, the trout was the best I've ever tasted, and the fried oysters were great which is saying something because I don't even like oysters. The owner, Al, came over and introduced himself and immediately made us feel welcome.  Lynne and Al made the night for us and we can't wait to go back.  Make sure you go. It is outstanding food.
Tried the pineapple cider for the first time. It was delicious!! Try the catfish Mac and cheese with collards!

This is a very small restaurant beside Michaels in the Arboetum Shopping Center.  We adore this restaurant.  Try the fried okra, fried oysters, shrimp pasta, collard greens.  Get a vegetable platter.  Go early as seating is limited.  You may want to google their hours of operation too.   We have been fans for a very long time!

The food was good and the service was great.  The only thing that I didn't love was my fish had a lot of bones that were not removed.  It was very obvious that they were there and the cook was careless.

Also, I think we were seated close to the back area where employees can take their smoke breaks, it smelled very strongly of smoke.  It was only an issue for me because I'm sensitive to cigarette smoke.

The food was good and the service friendly. That means a lot, so I would come back. However, the atmosphere inside wasn't that great. They have a concrete floor that has been painted. They have plain wood chairs and older style tables. Feels like a 60's diner or that old family restaurant that you never liked as a kid. We ordered 2 margarita's and I didn't care for them. Seemed to have little Tequila and the flavor tasted more like orange juice than Margarita. Perhaps they make their own mix, because they had several specialty ones. Probably my mistake to not have ordered the speciality. For an appetizer we had Calamari Okrachokie. It was tasty. Some fried Calamari, Fried Okra, and Fried Artichokes. I mean, fry anything and it's good right? I had Shrimp Ettoufee and it was tasty, pretty spicy. My wife had blackened Salmon, she said was good. My daughter got Fried Chicken, which was very good. My other daughter got a swordfish and fried shrimp, again good. 
So, if you want some Cajun style food this isn't a bad place. However, don't go here for the atmosphere. It has a mix of old diner and sports bar feel to it.

I've been working in the area for 3 years and never heard of this place. Why not? Its awesome!! I went for lunch with my 3 coworkers. We all ordered different entrees. I also ordered the Calamari since I HAVE to order it anytime I see it on a menu. For the most part I enjoyed it, though I wish it had been fried a bit crispier. It had Fried Okra and Artichokes in it which was a nice touch. I ordered the Chicken Cordon Blue. It was sooooooooo good! Soooooooo much flavor. It excited me as soon as that first bite hit my tongue. I also tried a bite of all of my coworkers food and everything has so much flavor. I was very pleased and excited to come back and try other dishes at this restaurant now knowing that nothing we ordered was bad. We also ordered the Banana Bread Pudding....... just no words... other than delicious!! I had only a couple bites because it is so rich. We all shared on and had some left over, even with me only having a couple bites. I will definitely be making this place a lunch regular!

I got the Catfish platter with Mac & Cheese and Potato Salad. It was some of the best catfish I've ever had, and I am pretty picky about catfish and Lowcountry food in general. The batter was awesome and so was the tartar sauce. The Mac & cheese was smooth, creamy, and cheesy. The potato salad has a kick to it. Our waitress was the sweet and knowledgeable Miss Emerald. Her expertise with the menu helped us pick the perfect meals. She knew how to engage in just the right amount of conversation to make us feel welcome and appreciated. Overall great experience. I'll be back, for sure.
So decadent! Had the shrimp and grits - to die for! Also had the chocolate pecan pie a la mode - no words, heavenly! Service - outstanding! Will be back again!

This is my favorite place to eat in South Charlotte.  Great Cajun food.  My favorite is the fried oysters with cuke salad and their awesome mac 'n' cheese (their mac 'n' cheese is NOT out of a box).  Their sweet tea would make my Southern grandma proud. 

To avoid crowds, for lunch I recommend arriving before 11:30 a.m. or after 1 p.m. and for dinner try to get there before 6 p.m.   CYD is not open on Sundays.

This is just a great little find with great N'Orleans-style food. Had the blackened trout. Mr. Bill had crayfish. Shared an appetizer of fried green tomatoes. I normally don't care for collard greens, but they were delicious. You have to try the bread pudding, if you have room. Pleasant staff. Good food. What more can you ask for! Oh, yeah, great variety of libations. Thank you for a new Tega Cay eatery that's good!!

The food was amazing and our waitress was friendly. There were a few regulars and they were more than happy to share their favorites. One lady even gifted my mother and I an order of bread pudding.... which replaced my mom's entire meal. The bread pudding came with ice cream and was drizzled in a sweet bourbon sauce. 

I ordered the Shrimp and Grits... the Grits were creamy and well seasoned. There were some other options that caught my eye, so I will be making my way back to this side of town.
